Service was excellent, especially given it was a busy night. One of the owners stopped by and it turns out, he grew up in the neighborhood. I love that! The new ownership is definitely doing justice to this gem.   If I could make one teeny suggestion, it would be with regard to seating. At the point we arrived, there were quite a few empty tables, yet we were seated right next to a large party. Not knowing how they assign reserved tables (ours was a last minute reservation), we didn't request a different table. However, I prefer when restaurants space out diners, filling in the space as the restaurant gets busy. To me it's odd to sit right next to other diners when the area is largely empty.  Thank you to Los Sombreros for a wonderful dinner. Now that we live in the neighborhood, we'll definitely be back soon...not in 10 years! After Easter...we gave up eating out for lent...I don't know why...I'm not even Catholic. Stupid move on my end.

Oxa2CzL7ty1tEeZir-JvvA.text: I love the chicken tacos from here. I've ordered them by delivery and sat down to eat and they are fabulous.

zv1fabbdWhmg-zw7M4SY5w.text: Came in with some friends over the weekend. The house margarita was lit as it can get- I prefer it strong rather than sweet so it was much to my liking. The taco options are very creative and tough to choose from... too bad they don't come with rice and beans with such a high price of $12 for 3 small steak tacos.... that was my only issue.   Great salsa with nice thin and warm chips... classic!   The place was much smaller than I imagined so I would assume on a busier night, a reservation would be smart.   Overall good night and would come back!

yWLT_d63ZNyiv7v99DjqXg.text: The hibiscus enchiladas are delicious, they have a combination of both savory and sweet, very distinct unique flavor!! The place is very comfortable and the prices are overall fair!

Y-83OrLyV_WgxTDHl0WnFg.text: Just plain good! Outstanding food and service. Love this place...  Taco's are great, try the Lamb Adobe, out of this world!

WfVVYfJk7XH7K8ZXbvCn7A.text: Mexican food restaurants are fun places to go to for birthdays so we chose Los Sombreros because we heard it has great food, drinks, and is really close by!   My margarita was really good and I just got a classic on the rocks with salt.  I chose a safe dish and ordered the chicken tomatillo tamales - very good but on the bland an dry side.  My bf got the chicken tacos and he said they were a little dry and bland as well. I had a bite of the crab enchiladas and those were tasty!   Loved the decor and ambiance inside. Our waitress was great! Knew the menu very well and was very friendly. I definitely will come back and try other things on the menu.

OnbLmG3Zh5N11SxFH-AsJg.text: I ordered my dinner thru Uber eats! Come to find out after waiting 40 minutes, This restaurant decides to  cancel my order!!! I understand you canceled my order,  but Cancel 5 minutes after my uber eats order, not 40 minutes, while I was anticipating my Mexican dinner.  Never never will I order from LOS SOMBREROS

CoYOZys-Z3QZ6Xh2RRWVog.text: Food here is amazing, always take my family on special occasions to celebrate here because we can all find something we love. Will always recommend the "Pollo con Espinacas"!!

O9St-fSFllluzVg2EhnxtQ.text: We ordered food to go through yelp from Los sombreros tonight. Sadly it was less than great. My husband had two crispy chicken tacos which were three small bite sized deep-fried pastry shells with a little chicken inside. I ordered the grilled chicken tacos. The meat had decent flavor but the corn tortillas were soggy.  Overall the bite sized quantity was not worth the price we paid. To be fair this was our experience with takeout so may be different in the restaurant.

kL2AzK1WN4Rkp_l8ATIhgQ.text: Excellent service!  Greater by the owner with excellent suggestions.  Cerviche excellent!   Lamb Seafood trio Steve- Cadillac

D5u_D4dBYoD6KI340OIslQ.text: First time I went to Los Sombreros was for a work lunch, tried their crispy potato tacos and fell in love with them. It took me back to the markets of central Mexico. Deliciosos! More times I have returned and all times their food has been exquisite!!! I'm vegetarian and there are options for everyone- Mexican food by nature it's not meat oriented. You will not find yellow cheese or piles of lettuce on the plates, but rather yummy Mexican red rice, beans that taste like home, fresh salsas and warm chips- and not the usual tomato hot sauce, prepare  yourself for roasted chilies and invested time of wonderful ingredients. Try the jicama-orange salad... refreshing and crunchy. Their crab salad, very fulfilling and fresh. One of my companions tried the soft tacos de carnitas- juicy, meaty, savory and like being on Mexico. Portions are very generous and healthy plated. Make space for dessert... piloncillo ice cream has Mexican cinnamon hint, flan? (Now I know where I can have a flan as great as mine) Go with time to seat, enjoy and relax. Food is fresh and perfectly seasoned. Service? The best!!! Since you approach the entrance until you leave. Very harmonious and lovely place! Salud Adan- and other owners. You guys are doing justice to Mexican food. Thank you and your team for what you're doing!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crab salad- with mango, cucumber, red bell pepper- delicious and fulfilling!
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crunchy potato tacos with rice and beans - los mejores!!!
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Piloncillo ice cream

1te56D75eRhZtgAEe6Uhxw.text: A couple days later and everything was perf. See previous review.   Apparently I need to write more or Yelp will spank me, so I guess I'll mention that Casamigos Mezcal is the bombdotcom.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vgFYztipGB1FT3xSs32wng.text: Absolutely fantastic food, margaritas, and ambiance. Went here three times in the course of a week. Tomato and oaxaca cheese salad, both huitlacoche appetizers, the chicken stuffed with huitlacoche, and the crab quesadillas--everything we ordered was a hit. Good tequila and mezcal menu. Very nice patio. Save room for dessert! The chocolate cream pie was delicious.  One comment for the chef on the tomato salad--the first time we ordered it, it didn't have jalapenos, and did have a little more cheese. We preferred it this way!

YYNh8pG7EfEsqsDlLjXMMQ.text: Had an awesome experience tonight. The food was amazing, the service was on point, and the atmosphere was very homey. I will be back very soon.  *Phoenix Foodies Approved!

aLasW3GTZG6armtZv-Ckjw.text: Cute place!  Very cozy, colorful and artistic, this stand alone restaurant offers a charming home feel.  Staff was very friendly and attentive.  I had a vegan enchilada stuffed with vegan cheese and spinach loaded with freshly sauteed veggies and a side of beans and rice.  This was a huge plate. I could only enjoy half of it. Ron had a plate of 3 chicken tacos, small but tasty, a bit shy on sauce but it didn't matter since they were so generous with their salsa and chips.  A definite good eatery and wonderful atmosphere for couples, families or just friends in search of a quaint Mexican restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vegan enchilada, a huge but tasty project!
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken tacos
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 3 salsas

dogiPizSEcDsUt03P2nz3w.text: So I've been here twice now, and I had to write a review for both experiences as neither have been all that great. This is a really cute place, nice atmosphere, cute patio, and the staff is pretty friendly. The owner came around to all the tables to say hello, which I why I'm not doing one star.  First experience: they sat us at a table that sat four people, we ordered an appetizer and a drink, and then they asked to move us because they had a party of four coming in that wanted to sit there. They apologized and comped our appetizer but that felt pretty crappy. Food wasn't on par.  Second experience: dirty table, slow greeting, warm beer due to frozen keg and they brought it out anyway instead of letting us know so we could change our order (they comped it... Ya thanks for the free warm beer), and finally the server decided to tell us when our food should have been coming out (about twenty minutes) that they were out of an ingredient for what I ordered, so I had to order something else which they brought out right away but told me they just happened to have an extra plate (it had been sitting in the window for a few minutes).... Just. Not. Happy. With that kind of inconvenience, that should have been comped, but instead they charged $12+ for three tacos and no sides.  Not coming back again.

QGzlHN99ixYK1y2nj7Z5pA.text: My wife and I were in the area and decided to give them a try. We're glad we did. Great authentic Mexican ambiance with both indoor and a great patio for outdoor seating. My wife had the vegan enchilada lunch and I had three chicken tacos on soft shells. Both entrees were extremely fresh and very tasty. You do have to wait a bit for your meals to arrive because everything is prepared fresh. It's well worth the wait. The service was excellent to add to a great lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EYXU6c4HEn4pBMA-HtJBiQ.text: Real nice people, food was below average priced ok for the portion of food but not for quality.  Ordered the Pastor tacos which should be named cochinita pibil which is a shredded pork.  Had no flavor, tasted like it was canned not home made.  Also tried the carnitas, was watered down, should have put it into a pan and crisped it a bit before putting it into the tortilla.  Never had carnitas served without atleast a side of cebolla and cilantro. Salsa was below average. Tried it because it is a really neat place but definitly wont be back.

xsl7S9nJRZQM6EuvYyy9aA.text: This place was absolutely phenomenal. As soon as we sat down, complimentary chips and dip was brought to the table. Our server, Tim, could not have been any nicer! I got a super yummy Paloma which was the perfect beverage to compliment the ceviche we got as a starter. For an entree, I got the crab enchilada which I will never get over it was so good. To end off our meal, we finished with creme brulee which was, like everything else, to die for. Best experience ever can't wait to go back!

rfXYzp02pkDMfFGIJN3wFg.text: This is one of my favorite spots in Scottsdale! All of the staff & the owners are very friendly and treat you like you're part of the family. My two favorite items are the Queso Fundido Rajas & the Alambre Ribeye Steak tacos. Both are sooo yummy. I highly recommend this place. Bottomless mimosas for brunch, happy hour, and a fun place to be...what more could you ask for! Definitely come check it out, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

J23OtHzfttiu9GrRafL4dQ.text: My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary thought this place was very nice but the service was horrible server kept forgetting that we were there the food was not that great  since they kept forgetting to bring all of it at the same time definitely not returning

PM47gaObEgXBEkq8QXThOQ.text: 18% guaranteed gratuity. The sour cream tasted old and smelled weird. Everything needed more salt. Server kept forgetting what drinks we originally ordered. Barely got checked on. Dropped check and didn't come back for quite a long time. Food subpar. Service subpar. Yolanda is not a very good server. She needed to get it together.

_UZoXWsExiqjAX-FeFLckg.text: Best fish tacos around!!  It's the only restaurant where my husband orders and eats fish tacos.

RAGvh4-Y2Vr8EVFdHJ8SYw.text: One of our very favorite Mexican restaurants in metro Phoenix, and an especially good place to bring out-of-town guests. The Mexico City-style cuisine is different from the more locally common Sonoran style, and delicious. Love to start off with that big tower of guacamole! They are also very attentive to food allergies here.

Kxkjze9C-AHlShnkxRnLUQ.text: Happy hour everyday from 3-6 with great deals! We have had all the quesadillas and they are the best! The watermelon salad is so refreshing especially in the hot summer months!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quesadillas
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Watermelon salad
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour is awesome!

fsF86oE531vPVQjelnm-hA.text: One of the best places I've ever eaten. Food is unique and tastes great. Every thing I've had here is wonderful! I've been here 3 times in the last week!

RfEhfamcIGvqgjnZr827NA.text: Los Sombreros is one of our favorite spots for Mexican food. My husband and I have been going here for years - back when we were first dating! We've always had a good time and a good meal here. However, we've only ever eaten dinner/happy hour here.  Our favorite is the Puerco en Chipotle. It's basically a huge portion of slow roasted and extra juicy pork in a chipotle sauce with Oaxaca cheese on top. Oh my god. This just melts in your mouth. The flavors are so good together. I just wish it had more cheese!   My husband has had the Lamb adobo before, which is a lamb shank in a spicy sauce. Again, this is really tender and flavorful.   I've had the smoked chicken enchilada dinners several times here and they are consistently good. The chicken is flavorful and blends well with the chipotle crema.   For happy hour we've had the grilled ribeye steak tacos, guacamole, and well margaritas. Everything was good, but the steak wasn't as tender as the other meats we've had here and probably wouldn't order again.   For dessert, they have rotating flan flavors. The traditional flan is my husband's favorite, but mine is the Bailey's/Kahlua flan. Oooh, oh so good. This is a great way to end the night.

QSlTdbuJ9qJ1yggnBFzXUg.text: This is my new favorite restaurant of any variety! The restaurant has recently changed ownership and the menu is outstanding. I've had several of the poblano meals and each was delicious. It's not on the menu but you must try the espinaca queso. Seriously the best appetizer ever! Fresh spinach, peppers, onions and tomatoes with lots of cheese and chipotle crema--to die for! There is a lovely patio for outdoor dining and it has private parking. Go there now!

HxiX-Kw3oy0rA7MLpPUGBQ.text: I love this place! Great food, friendly service, and a comfortable patio with trees instead of a parking lot view. The chicken mole and carnitas are awesome. The green enchiladas rock. Try the watermelon agua fresca margaritas for something different. The restaurant even supports local causes.

A3ijk_YpEHjbKeS01Aprtg.text: Well I am happy to write this update. Earlier this year I gave up on Los Sombreros in a huff... then not long after I saw an "Under New Management" sign on the building... Hmmm... interesting... They re-opened about a week ago so I decided to check things out.  What a difference! The updated place was busy, we were promptly greeted and sat by a very sweet and friendly employee. The vibe was upbeat and happy. The place still has it's unique charm but better-squeaky CLEAN with a better table layout and the place is spruced up a bit. The food was phenomenal- even better than I remembered. (my seafood crepes were great, but the chipotle pork.. ohmigod)  Yolanda took care of us and gave us great recommendations... when I shared how happy we were compared to our previous experiences she even introduced us to Jeff one of the new owners who shared their history and connections to South Scottsdale. It was great and I could not be happier that Los Sombreros has been revived!  We will be back again and again.

D-FE5PZ22LZPWwGIKzZ3sg.text: Gotta say I'm very disappointed in our experience tonight.  It was if they didn't want customers, as the tables on the potion were dirty, seat cushions were up to the customer to go find for their chair and they didn't even bother to turn on the musters to help us enjoy our experience.  The waiter was very nice but it was if they didn't want to be open on a Friday evening.

Lc6OkuiLvvdBX_In321chg.text: I had dinner at Los Sombreros for the first time this past weekend. I loved it!  I had the Pollo con Espinacas which included 2 sides as well as tortillas. The flavor was amazing. The 2 others in my group raved about their entrees as well - the seafood tacos & Hibiscus enchiladas. We were very pleased with our server and will definitely be dining there again. We can't wait to sit on the patio - great ambiance.

x5XRdfOjtljv5xCF4EXLlA.text: Best margarita of my life (no joke), and the place is cute, but the food is just "ok" and overly priced in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best margarita ever!!!

AbIgyyYxxrDW5_k2Dy97Kw.text: I purchased a coupon, this was my first time there and I went for lunch with a friend who had also never been.  It is a very nice atmosphere and more upscale than I was expecting.  We were taken to tall tables just off the bar.  I only saw one other couple in there and they were in another room with lots of windows.  The bar area is a bit dark but very nice. Our waiter brought us their drink menu and dinner menu.  Since I'd just been on their website I knew they had a lunch menu with $9.95 specials.  Even though we were there at 12:30 pm we had to specifically ask for their lunch menu.  This was red-flag #1.  My friend wanted one of those special margaritas whereas I asked for "just a plane old margarita."  The waiter said "so you want the 'house' margarita'" and walked away.  Both margaritas were very good, my friend was particularly pleased with his.  Mine was a little fancy for my taste.  He ordered the Chicken Enchilada and really liked it.  I ordered Chile Relleno, and while it was prepared very well, it wasn't like any Chile Relleno I'd ever had before.  It had a sweet taste to it and was very rich.  While I believe many would really enjoy the way they prepared, I wouldn't order it again.  I'm much more of a plane-Jane sort of guy.  When the bill came we were charged for two of the special margaritas my friend had ordered ($10/each).  We asked about it and the waiter said "that's just the way it comes up on the register; they're both the same price so it doesn't matter."  I wanted to know how a plane old margarita could be the same price as a "special" margarita and he explained that he'd brought me a "house" margarita, not a "well" margarita.  I guess a "well" margarita was what I thought my vocabulary was asking for but somehow things got confused in the translation.  This was red-flag #2. My friend will most definitely go back and take his wife.  He knows margaritas and prides himself in making them himself and immediately knew theirs were made with fresh lemons.  The waiter confirmed this.  While I wouldn't avoid this place, and even though they have very good food, drinks, and atmosphere, I'm the sort of person that is put-off by multiple red-flags.  Red-flags in this instance translate to "not total honesty."

i-rBQMTduOCFfUCz39VmJg.text: Los Sombreros Mexican Food is one of the best restaurants I have come across in central Arizona.  This is the original location, the other is further north.  The food is very much like what I have eaten in Mexico City, D.F. down through Guatemala and Honduras - so it is not your typical Sonoran style Mexican food so often served in Phoenix.  I had the potato tacos - really small, but absolutely totally filling and tasty.  Their salsas are different than anything I have tried at other restaurants - very pleasant taste, and not too hot.  Everything is made 100% from scratch, so that makes the higher prices worth it, in my opinion.  Service was excellent.

0Nwpcn8f4WZQwSLHJ5XXOQ.text: It does not get any better than  this.  We had the chili relines that were the most amazing things I have ever eaten.  The quest dip melted in your mouth and you wanted to eat it with a spoon.  The salads were refreshing and flavorful.  the guac was a gift from the waiter and there as no room for desert.  Don't miss this gem.

XFPUZ7yNE45I4z__9ejv4A.text: Went by today for the first time and I have to say it was one of the best most unique Mexican  places to eat in Arizona.  The service was great and the food was outstanding.  If your in the area you need to check this place out you will not be disappointed.

_ILrMFVOitDEqRxniL6a8A.text: Due diligence pays off as a continued exploration of the menu uncovers many flavors indigenous to Central Mexico that we typically don't encounter here. Most items won't have the heavy cheeses and sauces that cover up inferior dishes from other spots.  The more I eat here the more I miss the time I spent in Queretero, Mexico.

BgzX2NAUmswtU0BhQ1rmvg.text: The only reason this is not rated a one star is that one out of the five entrees was OK.  The other four were not really hot when served, tasteless and way overpriced.  We will not be returning to this place.

evAQyQPhS-idOGyIJOkraA.text: Los Sombreros has a charming atmosphere and unique, high quality food cooked and served by a friendly Mexican staff. The restaurant is in an old brick house with a nice patio filled with lights and trees. It was quiet there for a Saturday night, which is a shame considering Salty Senorita and the other fake Mexican places down the street in Old Town are making more money selling guacamole squeezed out of a plastic bag. Los Sombreros costs a few dollars more than maybe it should, but the portions were large, fresh and served with lovely presentation. I had enchiladas with hibiscus, which tastes like a sweet jam. I recommend the food and the ambiance, just wish more people would support their family owned business!

M0MY2KChe0BgHNu6bbWlDw.text: I would not feed their food to starving ethiopian child. I ordered the chilis rellenos. It was a bowl full oil to start. The batter on the chilis had the texture of soggy bread. The chilis themselves had the consistency of tire that was filled with mozzarella and corn. I am about 90% positive they were frozen to start and just placed in a bowl and microwaved. The overall consensus of the group of 6 I was with was the same or worse. I was nauseated by the smell of my brothers fish which could smelled over the entire patio which was similar to the smell of a tackle box. Everyone is is basing their review off the patio seating but there was nothing more special about it other than the fact it was outside. The most genuine thing there was the mr. Pibb and my discontent.My favorite part of the meal was excusing myself from the table and smoking a cigarette. Even the margaritas and chips and salsa were subpar...didnt know that was plausible. Go to taco bell...

PbYa3ec1QJYZfTMAmoocNQ.text: Excellent strawberry margarita. Best Mexican in Scottsdale. Awesome patio. Terrific atmosphere. Well worth it. I will definitely go back.

VAU7yDp3aukmDFbv9sy1Jg.text: I'd like to know the "other" Mexican food places that are so much better. Los Sombreros is awesome! The drinks are poured with a heavy hand, which almost justifies paying $9 a cocktail, but that's to be expected at a lot of places. The salsa, first off, is to die for! The hotter of the two has a very strong chipotle flavor, which I love, but for those who don't the other one was just as good. The weird little pinwheel wheat things they give you with the chips are not my cup of tea, but just about everything else is. I think the spot is totally quaint and charming, and the servers are always accommodating. I'm vegan and started disecting the menu when the waitress asked if I was vegan, and I am, she suggested I get the chef's special vegan dish- rarely does that happen! It was amazing, the sauce was incredible, the potatoes mushrooms and corn were cooked to perfection and I appreciated the extra veggies and avocado. My boyfriend loved his, which was a fish dish, and everytime I go everyone loves it! Try it out.

erAj4EeBLb7mPXxwvwI5uQ.text: Some co-workers and I were looking for some good Mexican near our hotel while on a business trip in Scottsdale. Yelp led us here. The chips and salsa were very good, and bottomless. The quesadillas were very good and the meal quite filling. The place has nice unique decor too, which is always a bonus. On the odd side, they have a strict policy against separate checks. You can pay one check with 4 different credit cards, but you can't get 4 checks instead. Whatever, it didn't cause any problems.

09gsszGzLS0ppp1STIhA8g.text: We have friends that consistently rave about this place, but then again they think Macaroni grill is the best Italian going! We finally decided to give it a try. Overall it was way way overrated and overpriced. When you walk in to get seated you have to walk through the bowels of the kitchen - not a nice first impression. The staff was friendly and the dining room ambience was nice. The guacamole was very good, but it better be for $10!! My mojito was good as well, but again, $10 is a bit much for a small drink. That's all the positives I have to say about the food. My husband ordered the ribeye steak tacos and they were all fat. He suffered through them because we were with a group of 8 and didn't want to complain. Another person in our group didn't get their food until about 20 min. after the rest fo the table because the waitor had mistakenly left it off the order. We ended up sitting there with our food getting cold because we didn't feel comfortable eating in front of our foodless friend. We were surprised that they didn't comp his meal or do anything to make it right. We didn't say anything - but they really should given him something for the long delay. I ordered the Camarones con tequila al ajillo which was recommended to me by the waitor. The presentation was nice, but the portion was tiny (for $20.95) and the food was tasteless and it was full of huge strips of fatty bacon. I hope you love corn tortillas, because they don't even offer flour! My son ordered a kids quesadilla and I had them add chicken to it (it was just plain cheese on the menu). They charged me an extra $4 for about 2 tblsp. of chicken. His entire meal was one corn tortilla folded in half - no sides. He is 7 and was still starving when he finished. The quesadilla at Taco Bell is better. They also snuck a $3 charge to our bill for a tiny side of sour cream for my son. So a "snack" for my son ended up costing us $9! We would never recommend this place or visit again. Not my idea of a $70 night out!

AK1t_zi0WJ-BL_hjY32zvg.text: I am totally shocked that some on here have had bad experiences because, in my view, this is as good as it gets.  I've been a big fan of Los Sombreros since I first went to it when it was located in the strip mall by the Big Lots.  There was absolutely nothing I could complain about there - not Tex Mex, but real Mexican food.  The salsa is smoky and five star.  I am personally a fan of battery-acid hot food and they had a habanaro salsa that was, well, YIKES and YUM at the same time.  The guacamole is one of the best I've ever had and the seafood tacos appetizer is something I absolutely love and think of often made with crema - not Americanized sour cream.   They are amazing.  I also am in love with the crab enchiladas and the puerco en mole verde.  My husband - a definite mole afcionado, loves their mole poblano and rates it second to none.  Margaritas are very good and the chocolate tamal with that carmel sauce and ice cream....wow.  I have taken four different people here on different occasions and all of them agreed it was sublime.

9zUZ9LvON_IDHqYSgcuQQg.text: Los Sombreros is the best authentic Mexican food in the valley.  That is a bold statement, especially with offerings like Barrio Cafe, but the attention to detail, authenticity and one of the coziest patios around makes Los my favorite Mexican spot. We have been several times and always order the same thing so this time around we thought we would try one of the new items on the menu.  I am so glad we did. We started with the crepes appetizer and the fig & panela salad. The crepes were amazing. They were filled with goat & blue cheese and had a delicious pomegranate sauce on top. The salad with figs had a honey lime dressing that was divine.  My husband usually gets the seafood crepes but had the Ribeye instead.  He was totally obsessed! He loved that it was covered with a chipotle and pineapple salsa. And of course every time we go we have to get their tasty margaritas and the chips and guacamole. You can't go wrong with those!

ZEyS8VyZiPUHCG767PVZBg.text: We ventured up Scottsdale Road on Monday night because my inlaws wanted to take us out for dinner and they wanted Mexican. The sign for the restaurant out front is not that big, so definitely pay attention. The patio is really cute, but we opted to sit inside. Inside is small and cozy with exposed brick. I felt instantly at home.  My mother-in-law and I had the House Special margaritas which we both liked, although I have to say that the margaritas my mother-in-law makes at home are way better. For appetizer, we tried the queso fundido with crab which we all loved. Nice pieces of lump crabmeat and a nice manageable size for an appetizer. For dinner, I had the chicken tacos which were delicious. The chicken was cooked perfectly and there was plenty of it in the tacos. Even though it's listed as an appetizer, it was more than enough food for me for dinner especially after eating the queso fundido. My mother-in-law had the goat cheese and blue cheese crepes with pomegranate sauce; I snagged a bite...delicious! My father-in-law had the seafood tacos which he really liked (I didn't get to sample them). My husband had the crab enchiladas which I also snagged a bite of...they were good and the tomato chipotle sauce gave the dish a nice kick. We did however both taste a bit of shell which was unfortunate.  Our server was really nice and paid just the right amount of attention to us. I didn't get a chance to see the final bill since my father-in-law was paying, but the prices were very reasonable considering the amount of food you received. I think the most expensive entree I saw was about $20 which includes two sides. Definitely a place we will return to especially when it's nice out to sit on the patio.

DeDT6CSHSYScvmxrEb_wqQ.text: i went there last monday to have some dinner with some friends n WOW the food was awesome , i had the pork with chipotle n its sooooooo good n this is coming from a legit mexican , i will def go back there soon ....... if you go see Arturo the bartender he is very nice .

n-gwiJpqZ-OA72GV2BM4Vg.text: Authentic Mexican Cuisine in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale, Los Sombreros provides a rich and friendly destination for anyone looking for a plate sizzling, mouthing watering experience.   Just south of Thomas Los Sombreros has been providing its patrons with stiff, sweet, and ohh so salty Patron Margaritas since its founding and its a great place to stop at the bar for a quick drink a some tasty guacamole.  A little pricey for a Mexican restaurant and the service can be a little suspect but in the end definitely one of the best authentic restaurants in Scottsdale.

Tnc0CU2SlaOf8akGsFOJJw.text: I can't say that anything was great at Los Sombreros!  The margaritas were bland, the salsa is not like any salsa I've ever seen before, the chicken tacos were tasteless.  I'll never go back there again...although our waitress was darling and attentive.

CHuPGiofxPPIxK5cXAS4qg.text: It was good but not great especially given the prices,  I had the carnetas and I have better for much less then what I was charged here.  The rest of my family thought the food was good but not worth the price charged.  Did not have the margaritas. The guacamole I have to say was among the best I have ever had.  Did not like the salsa.  Service was so-so. Next time I want Mexican I will go elsewhere.

mq4prOPjR0DrC0OgDvAzRg.text: I could not agree more with Alicia B's review. I went here with my husband Saturday night, it is in our nieghboorhood and we had heard decent things. We waited about 10 minutes for a table, not because it was full or busy. The hostess looked a right at us, no acknowledgement and then she went on to what must have been more important business. Finally, a passing waiter sat us. The service continued to be inattentive and slow. Our cocktails were tasty, I had a pomegranire margarita and my husband has something with a kooky name, I think it mentioned a Donkey. We had the Queso with crab which was pretty good, the crab could have been tastier and the whole thing needed some spice. The chips and salsa, OK. I had the carnitas, after recommendation by our waitress. Not bad, but certainly not good and not worth $17. My Husband has the seafood crepes, they were OK, but lacking flavor. The food was not bland, but flat, just meh. This place would be a 3 star, but for the price, it is coming down to a 2 star.  The building and patio are really cool and set a good atmosphere, too bad the food and service don't follow suit.   On a side note I did get to overhear a great conversation by two guys visiting from out of town, probably in thier mid to late 40s. I guess last time they came here the women were way hotter. This time there are hot women, but they are not as common. They seemed to like the place, one of them remarked the only thing better than his food was getting laid earlier that day.

BxzGqkXHN9WzQ2YefnTPuw.text: Our hotel concierge recommended this place.  We sat outside under the heating lamps and the vibe was great.  The appetizers were quite tasty (seafood tacos were yummy while the chorizo fondue was not what we expected but still okay).   The entrees were not that great.  We only had to wait 5 minutes, but then it was also a Sunday night.   Portions are pretty large... we ended up doggy bagging half our entrees.

hmmt-kePQSDH16Gfs8IRxw.text: We can't get enough of Los Sombreros amazing food and the patio atmosphere is perfect 80% of the year.  You truly won't find anywhere else like it in Scottsdale.   We've brought along our toddler the last few times as we couldn't resist the enticement of Pollo con espinaca and they have been very accomodating.

BtgnoENhD09TJQkRsCTx5A.text: Great margaritas and food. Love the patio. We live in AZ after all. We need to be outside. Last meal ordered there was seafood crepes and they are awesome. And try the guacamole. But be careful, with a few margaritas the bill creeps up there.

EAr7h47eTZ3H72BfnZwSXw.text: The menu has very unique selections. The service is spotty like a lot of local Mexican restaurants but certainly adequate. The drinks are over -priced but I do think the menu offers some nontraditional Mexican dishes that many people would enjoy. The skirt steak is solid. Used to go here when it was across the street in the shopping center but at least now it has more character.

NQSYrtLaIT5uUQkZgQpnWg.text: Great margaritas, gauc, queso, and tacos. We went to lots of fancy restaurants on our trip to Phoenix, but this place was better than all of them.

WrIXdyw6KxMjIoq38ZXCvQ.text: Amazing food and Margaritas! You will not be let down, try the puerco en chipotle!

xjTNHVTKXRRSzMN3q9j4xA.text: I was looking for chile rellenos and this place does a great job of making them just the way I like it.  Flavorful and not dry.   Also had the chips and salsa which I did not think were anything special and you have to order them unlike most Mexican places where it is expected at the time they serve the drinks.  Flan was unimpressive.  I think I will go back for the chile rellenos and head down the street to Carlsbad Tavern for the flan (theirs is my favorite).

98_aU2PtVk6iqAwfFCXq0g.text: Authentic flavors, modern twists.  Food quality was fantastic.  Tequila selection is incredible. The patio seating was fabulous.  Our server was helpful.  Really, nothing more you could ask for.  Will be a new regular spot.

dxcujGZULgg0xs6eog4iHA.text: We tried to get here for the 10 course tasting meal before the end of the month. Since we live 15 miles away we called on Friday at 5 to see if we could make a reservation before driving all the way there. Their policy in general about reservations is to not take any except for parties of 5 or more and it applied to the special dinner as well. I asked if there was any problem getting in that evening. "No problem, come on in." We left right away and got there a little after 5:30. Well, there were problems. First was parking. There is limited on site parking, all taken. There is street parking on Virginia Street and extending into the neighboring residential area, all taken. There was parking across the street but that was clearly marked as reserved for the business in that location. I waited in the car for ten minutes for a spot while my wife went in to see what the situation was and to get a table, if possible. After ten minutes a spot opened up in the parking lot but before I could back up and take it, someone else arrived and slipped into the spot right in front of me. Maybe they are regulars and know that when it comes to parking courtesy goes by the wayside. Frustrated I left the car in the middle of the lot and went in to see what was happening to my wife. She had stood for a few minutes at the entry before someone acknowledged her presence. She asked about a table for two and was told, with a wave of the arm, to take a seat anywhere on the left in the dining area and then that person walked away. And that is where she was sitting when I found her. She had not seen a waiter or received a menu. I wondered how long someone would have to wait before the staff realized they had a customer. At that point we left. What does this place need? Better parking, a reservation system at least for peak hours, and attentive staff. The food might be good but we wouldn't know.

xImCL_7W4ax49qOtuzT_vA.text: Here's the deal- As far as food goes, this place deserves 5 stars, its inventive, fresh, Mexican food and always amazing. The location is great and I would love to frequent it. However, the owner Azucena Tovar always comes off as a little ambivalent about her clientel, and I just can't get over it. We eat out a lot. My expectation and hope is an evening with great company, food, and service. Great company I can handle, great food Los Sombreros has covered...but the service makes me wince. The owner is the first person to greet you at the door and she is abrasive and has been rude (kinda sets the tone, it's her place after all). Not once, not twice, but several times. I try and support businesses that value and appreciate their clients, especially in this financial climate. So my compromise is take-out. We only (rarely) order take-out and on the condition my husband picks it up so I dont have to be reminded why we no longer eat there. Christmas tamales are to die for.

wRaI0gR0-Xdk75aSu--Pwg.text: This is more authentic Mexican food -- not the type that's smothered with cheddar cheese or the salsa that you're used to seeing in a jar.  Quesadillas are not the type that you would find at say, a Chili's -- two large flour tortillas with some cheese in the middle.  They're made of fresh masa and are stuffed with rajas, and are more akin to fried turnovers than your standard Americanized quesadilla.  Other than the quesadillas, we ordered the mole verde and seafood tacos, both of which were excellent.  The chips came with two types of salsa.  I was a huge fan of the chunkier spicier one.  Even the veggies were good -- not the standard onion and pepper mix, and perfectly cooked.

L8M7OdNgc_FA6uxw5qpaQA.text: I must say I am slightly disappointed to see all the low stars. I recently went to dinner here with some out of town guests and my family. It was a bit crazy and busy,  so we got some margaritas at the bar while we waited  for a table. The margaritas were delicious- we each tried a few different ones, and all of them were delicious. As we began our meal we started off with chips, salsa, and guacamole. The guac was delicious and fresh, however I could have used a little more spice in the salsa. Also I was a little taken aback by the wagon wheel chips but after a bite or two, I could see why some people may enjoy them.  My one major gripe about this place was the fact that it seemed like our waitress disappeared for a bit. We had finished chips and salsa and our first round of drinks before she came back to take our dinner orders. I had the crab enchiladas. They were amazing. I also tried a bite of my dads seafood crepes, and now I know next time what I will be getting. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food, and we took leftovers home, which were just as delicious. I would definitely like to go here again, but hopefully with better service. I would eat here again.

se1W-wgkjFO6wS6ingrv-A.text: if you want the real deal mexican this is the place... i have never heard of it until i sat next to a lady from mexico city on a plane... right when i landed i went and i fell in love... the food is great and not your tex mex burro and fijatas... a must to check out!!!

RKJ9G3NlWPzJfh-kcaNR0g.text: I have been eating here for years and love it.  There is not an item on the menu that is less than amazing and the Mexican chocolate cream pie is the most delicious thing ever.  Make sure you get an order of guac...yummmmmmm

rrL0meXsS3e2zew6Uf7sag.text: I want to like this place more than I do. It is 5 minutes from my house and such a great space, with an adorable patio. But other than those perks, there is nothing really impressive about it. I went once for a few months ago, right after receiving a mailer announcing new management. Nothing stood out then, but I decided to give it another try since they added brunch and sent a buy-one-get-one-free offer. Had a decent margarita and chips and salsa. Salsa is fine, chips are thin and crispy and seem like they might be made in-house but if they are, they should be served warm. I had the huevos rancheros with carnitas, served with roasted small potatoes. It looked so tasty but was bland and uninteresting, even once I doused some Cholula on it. We split the Mexican French toast. The different sauces drizzled on it (chocolate, caramel and pomegranate) blend together and the texture is really moist, more like bread pudding than French toast. The fresh whipped cream was a nice touch. Given how much more I like similar places - Barrio Cafe, Barrio Queen, Gallo Blanco - I do not think I would pick this place again.

sc0UUsTUN-C_4pMyWAbGfA.text: Really not good. I ordered a quesadilla and I got an empanada then was told it was a traditional deep fried quesadilla. It wasn't a quesadilla and not good. Most entrees are at least 15.

pzNpSIf9FI99MzPBlxzc6w.text: Best Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale. Not too far from old town Scottsdale. What you'll find is a friendly atmosphere and fantastic food. Authentic Mexico City style food. Outdoor patio in the back is inviting and comfortable. With owners on site their customer first attitude never gets old. I spent three months in Arizona and visit this restaurant at least twice weekly. Don't miss taco Tuesday. And no I am not a relative of the owner or anyone who works there.

5kJYtjmI5xhz4QndHIeTqQ.text: This has become our go to Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale. Non-Americanized delicious Mexican food.  Everything I've had at this restaurant to eat I've loved. The quesadillas are wonderful the tacos are outstanding. Keep an open mind not what you would expect at any Americaniced Mexican restaurant.  Food is delicious service is friendly and prompt owners are on site and friendly.

YWuBLv0yqdkWWJ2ErB766Q.text: Amazing food, amazing drinks, and amazing service. I'm not entirely sure why this only has 3.5 stars. It is by far one of the best Mexican restaurants I've eaten at in some time.

kYCwLVAKi_pIvJEriNMx6w.text: Soooooooo good! Loved the environment, the bar was the bomb, the food fricken ahmazing!  BONUS, I found out it's the original restaurant from Jeff of Elotes in Sedona. Whuaaatttt? Elotes has been my favorite Mexican restaurant ever!! New Owners Kurt and Geoff have got it going on!!!

13ieX9iNbMmt2QY8FrnXcw.text: After a day at nearby Desert Botanical Gardens our large group was extremely pleased with our meal at Los Sombreros. Everyone from Grandma to the youngest (5 and 3 year old) grandkids, Omnivores and Vegetarians alike, loved their food choices and their selection. With a wide array of choices from pedestrian cheese quesadilla to adventurous huitlacoche (corn smut) pechuga rellena.  We loved it. Highly recommend.

bLWmaL7UIF58siBmY_deAA.text: Lunch with flies, dirty glasses & crusty utensils. It seemed like a great place until we sat down in the corner & started fighting flies. They were all over the place & we had to constantly swat them away. We had to have the water replaced because one fell in the glass. The replacement glass of water was filthy with lipstick marks all around the edge. YUK!  So we looked closer at the table & had to get the utensils replace because we were picking stuff off the surfaces. We should have left immediately but had already placed our orders. The salsa is very good but it was downhill after that.  I have NEVER had a chili rellenos dish served in a bowl, floating in enough liquid to call it a soup. The flavor was good but the entire dish was a soggy mess. Because of these things, I can barely give them 1 star & would never recommend them to anyone.

RG5l1GXKpcU3QNrosWHGEg.text: Just left this restaurant... got tired of waiting for someone to greet us and take our order.  Not worth the price when the service is so poor. (every entree is over $20, you have to pay for chips.) We won't be back.

-cKlUtRkPCCQfQzqEGHneA.text: Had the absolute WORST experience last night at this restaurant!!! They didn't have our reservation for 20-30 people and shoved us outside on a teeny tiny patio. It was very awkward, the road noise was so bad our speaker had to change the format of the entire event! But that was just the beginning! We waited for 30-40 mins to get orders taken, then another 45 for the food to arrive, the waiter was the absolute rudest I have ever encountered. I have worked in many, many restaurants and understand when things are slammed or other factors but this guy was such a jerk! During this entire time the owner knew our situation and apparently didn't care because he never came to our table to apologize or make it right. Plus there was a 20% auto gratuity added for some guy to take forever and be a jerk! The two appetizers they comped hardly made up for the horrific experience! Oh and one stall for over a hundred people doesn't seem like enough bathrooms. I will NEVER go back to this hell hole. I advise you all to do the same and stay away.

B3XtUC1dPd5hItUKZwFCRA.text: The new owners are great!! Really bringing this place back!! They were able to accommodate our large party for a special event. Food was amazing so much flavor, "Steve's margarita" was how a margarita should be. We'll be back again soon.

FMEivnsHSxNOBHnIirLwVA.text: I'll give it a 2star for ONLY the look of the place... Seat yourself at a table and play the waiting game. Went to this restaurant with my family and service was crap, one lady(maybe a host or owner idk she didn't bother introduce herself) came by asked if we're okay, we asked for a high chair and she said she'd get us one(she never came back to our table). The waiter came by got our drinks order and he was not so helpful, I think he was the only waiter for the restaurant because he was running around each table. Anyways, I wanted order chicken enchiladas but it has spicy sauce on top so I asked if the cook could put the sauce on the side and his response was "No" so I had to rethink another entree. We asked for quesadilla for kids and if they could add chicken in it he said "no". The salsa was watery and not good.  After waiting and waiting and waiting we decided to get up and leave. So far the only thing that went good was our soda drinks! My guess is that everything is pre-made and that's why they couldn't put anything on side or add.  I would never recommend this restaurant. I forgot to mention OVERPRICED!!! We ended up at the Mexican food place directly across from them lol got better food excellent service and more reasonable price.

2dGUqRqOXrRHJFJrEe93ZQ.text: The Los Sombreros 10 Course Tasting Menu ($50. for TWO) is PHENOMENAL and is something you shouldn't miss out on if you are thinking of trying flavors of Central Mexico as the special will end sometime call or check website. I was told they are extending the special past August to promote the new menu and new restaurant they are opening.  You get. Chips and two Fresh Salsas.  Two cups Pozole Soup Two Hibiscus Taquitos Fig & Panela Cheese Salad Shrimp & Papaya Salad Salmon with Mango Salsa Trout with Almonds in Lemon Butter & Capers Chile Rellenos with Beef Picadillo Pechuga Rellena (Stuffed Chicken Breast in Chipotle Tomato Sauce) Pork Loin with Tamarind Mole House Made Piloncillo Ice Cream  Everything had delicious flavors.  I never had Hibiscus Taquitos before and they were a stand out. A little sweet and cheesy and tangy they were delicious.  The Chile Relleno stuffed with Beef were very unlike any other I had before being much lighter and MUCH tastier than any other I ever had. I liked that they weren't a fried battered kind like you get at most places and only had just the right touch of cheese on them.  The four entrees were all delicious but a few were over cooked but very ACCEPTABLE and that is the only reason I didn't up this place to five stars but I was five stars happy.  The house made Ice cream was very fresh tasting and the most creamy ice cream I remember trying in a while.  This place is far above average and is very good but it's a small place and many tables inside are high tops.  ***UPDATE****the chef and ownership has changed since my visit******  4.5 Stars

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pechuga Rellena (10 Course Feeds TWO $50. Special ) Chicken, Chipotle Tomato Sauce, Huitacoche, Goat Cheese.
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork Loin with Tamarind Mole ( 10 Course feeds Two $50. Special )
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chile Rellenos with Beef Picadillo ( 10 Course feeds Two $50. Special )

GHMYCC6S_wfbnd9Y617W2w.text: Went in for a bite with my GF and our 3yo and had a great meal. My tamales were fantastic and my GF loved her veggie tacos. The guacamole was delicious also and almost our undoing as we got it to start

TYR5sw2xa6s0CEaZkCdlWw.text: I have lived within walking distance for 3+ years, and should have eaten here long ago! I took my dad and child in for an early dinner. We had the guac (best I have ever had and I have eaten a lot of guac), tortilla soup and green chili tamales. My dad had a beer and I had a house margarita. All the food was so flavorful! The ambiance was great too, super authentic and looks like you are in a little Mexican house. I found my new favorite neighborhood spot!

Ov75KEHuNPlevMD377lucQ.text: This is the best restaurant. Good was delicious and I had a pomegranate margarita I still think about! Marvelous!!  Service was great ... Must go!!

iEsj5WE_9Bf2IU5LpTzUaw.text: Good carnitas, guacamole, and margaritas. I loved dining on the patio.  Prices are a tad on the higher side than what I am used to paying for the average Mexican restaurant, but overall I give it a solid 4 stars.    Tip- you may want to make a reservation

Qz7GdVHP09yb06tLjmjDBQ.text: This would be five stars if I wasn't gnawed by no-seeums while seated inside near a window. But I love the wood fire smell from the parilla.  This re-purposed brick house is charming, despite the reluctance of the desert to really vacate the premises.  I had a delicious, dark green, tender poblano in white sauce.  It was filled with mixed white and dark meat chicken and queso.  Quak was chunked and distinctly spiced with lime on a too-tall bed of shredded lettuce.   Service is a little spacey, but definitely accommodating. Parking is really easy.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Donkey has vodka and cream soda

Jyk0A2Jvt_SPjPecBxkkjA.text: Authentic Mexican cuisine. Gorgeous atmosphere. inside and especially outside. it's my 3 rd visit and I can't seem to get over the tamales. got the trio of tamales. one chicken. one beef. one corn. all amazing. Arturo my server \bartender was engaging, knowledgeable, and kept me entertained as a single person diner. I'd recommend him every time. what an great experience and Im absolutely hooked and will return soon and often. Jimmie

u3nOq7GUOTyOjUL801Q5eQ.text: Had the Tuesday fish taco special and the stuffed poblano pepper dinner and it was excellent.

5WH7iyAEavh8tc7LZzg_PQ.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale.  The staff is amazing. The food is even better. I can't wait to go back.

d4JtwDCjOoR1PtClK6JEXA.text: My husband and I went for dinner and sat at the outdoor bar. The misters were on so it wasn't too hot to be able to sit outside. Moses was our bartender and waiter and he always makes great Margaritas. I started with a Steve-A-Rita and then had the Cadillac Margarita and both were excellent. For dinner my husband and I shared the tomato and Oaxaca cheese salad with had fresh tomatoes and perfect amount of Oaxaca cheese, some jalapenos and a very light tasty dressing. Our main course was the chicken mole enchiladas aka. chicken enmoladas which I hadn't had in years and was my very first go to dish here. It is 2 enchiladas with mole sauce and cheese and it is so very good. Their mole is excellent. It came with sides of re-fried beans (which they have the best), rice and steamed vegetables. For dessert we shared a slice of one of my favorites pies that they make; pecan pie with a side of homemade brown sugar ice cream; so very yummy! We will certainly return soon.

h820B9DEh1rcv0rNEP4veQ.text: Good Mexican restaurant. They cater at my work sometimes and we are always very happy with the food! Love the restaurant and the patio. It feels very authentic not just another hip restaurant like many in the old town area. Worth a shot and nice for a family dinner or date night.

U2aBCpQnJoXhDRMM-Kva3w.text: Wonderful place and authentic Mexican food for sure.  Just a little too spicy for my taste.  Our waiter was very friendly and made us feel at home even though we were there around closing time.  He didn't try to rush us and took the time to give us a little history on both the bulding and the restaurant.

Weeq3MVUhs4OGKH-BTKAWg.text: Very good authentic Mexican food. Drinks were OK...  Salsa was kind of bland... We would go back because our dinners were excellent... chipotle pork carnitas and smoked chicken enchiladas were very good. Vegetables were offered as a side and they were delish!

K1_ta3B9VHPvzLgf5i5x6w.text: Delighted with our decision to dine here! With 6 guests, our server Jesus skillfully guided us through the menu, helping us steer around a food allergy and one who preferred less spicy. Kitchen even went off menu to accommodate a special request.  I was absolutely blown away by the pork in mole verde; melt in your mouth tender chunks of pork in a spicy creamy velvet pool of green heaven. So good. I asked for a spoon! Extensive menu, reasonable prices, highly recommend. Wish I lived closer!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork in mole verde

4QZjxjrIjI8YDCvwvLTKnw.text: My husband and I popped in to Los Sombreros on Friday night for a little date night and had a wonderful time! First, the building is the CUTEST! It is a little brick house that is so warm and inviting. They have a wonderful patio with misters - yes, you guys, we actually wanted to sit outside in August! This never ever happens with me. The service was so friendly and we had a great experience.   We started with their DELICIOUS chips, salsa, and guac. The guac was so yummy and I love their chips - thin and crispy! Their salsas are also homemade and very tasty. They made me a pretty mocktail as well which paired perfectly with the munchies. Sometimes virgin margaritas can be way too sweet but not this one! It was perfect.   We both had a pretty big lunch so we were looking to have a lighter dinner, hence the salads. I ordered their tomato salad + added chicken and it was amazing! It was like a Mexican Caprese salad and the dressing was a dream. My husband ordered their fig salad (it was huge!) and he loved it. We were both super satisfied.  They also have daily specials and our server mentioned that they have incredible specials + live music on Sundays! I can't wait to bring our pup back on a cooler Sunday to hang out on their lovely patio. We'll absolutely be back soon. I'm so happy that I re-discovered this South Scottsdale gem.

hxSmfISUHy9lkZGjcD4qfQ.text: We dropped in last minute and found the space to have quaint decor, clean with an cozy dining area.  They quickly greeted us and brought water.   We decided on their house Margaritas which are made with their homemade mix that has lemon and lime juice plus a little bit of simple syrup.  They went down really well.  As a starter we each ordered the taste of summer watermelon salad. The flavors were amazing jicama watermelon red pepper cucumber cilantro all delicious.  My sister got the ceviche which was super tasty and I had the shrimp cocktail also very flavorful!  I highly recommend this locally owned restaurant. And Jesus the waiter was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Watermelon salad, delicious!

gyDGDQm66c2yjnsGC02Ezg.text: First time here, Pulled up on a very very busy night, but Haley (greeter) was able to find a empty patio table searched, found and brought two chairs from other areas to get us seated. Great job Haley you were very nice, courteous, and professional!  This place is Very clean has a very cultured menu. Food presentation was great. Sat in patio with great service from Karly who was young, sweet and sincere!   Dinner was very tasty, not spicy at all yet so balanced and flavorful! Great variety to select from. I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Large basket of thin fresh chips.
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork in chipotle sauce, so tender and juicy.
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cadillac style. Not so balanced. Little strong and hard going down.

nZqHVSNGlYxshwDwFxV61Q.text: Very unique and delicious Mexican food!  Chip and salsa 4/5- crispy chips and 2 kinds of salsa. One was mild and had a smoky flavor the other was chunkier and had more of a kick which I preferred.  I ordered a Paloma (2/5)was a little disappointed because it didn't have the tajin rim and couldn't taste any grapefruit at all. Tasted like a margarita with soda. Would rather have ordered a margarita   The quesadillla appetizer (5/5)handmade thick  fried corn tortillas filled with lots of cheeses and covered in sauce! We all enjoyed this.   Shrimp and goat cheese tacos (4/5) great flavor just a little lacking, it needs some slaw or greens with it.   Al pastor tacos (5/5) great flavor on the pork and love the fresh pineapple on top.   Kids chicken enchiladas (5/5) I tried a bite and it was so delicious! Lots of shredded chicken, cheese and the sauce was perfect! Huge portion for a kids meal   Mexican chocolate pie (5/5) we devoured this! Only thing I wish it was bigger and had more crust!   Overall it was a great experience and our server Yolanda was sweet. I definitely recommend this place if you are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Paloma??? Tasted like a margarita soda!
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 3 Shrimp and Goat Cheese Soft Tacos
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kids chicken enchiladas

6lQeMzhvbJi-YBsBcmcgfA.text: I looovveee Mexican food and this is always great!! Definitely recommend! Good place to go!

oTG1qvXO5kd6FtMUDQD3OA.text: We enjoyed some tequila and tacos here on Taco Tuesday! Unfortunately when we received the bill, the tacos we had supposedly ordered as part of happy hour were not discounted after all. So that disconnect between what the host told us about "Taco Tuesday" and what we actually experienced was disappointing as we were looking forward to enjoying happy hour prices. Overall, the ambiance is very quaint and COZY to say the least. Quite a small dining room so reservations are most likely a must. We'll probably return to try some of the more expensive/higher-end meal options such as lamb or steak and perhaps sit on the lovely, lighted patio during a warmer season!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

drF6OeFWQAqZIIirPrHI6Q.text: Really enjoyable evening! Even with a large group, the waiters did a great job topping off our drinks,making sure our orders were all correct and splitting the checks as well. The chips and salsa was really good! They had a smokey salsa I really enjoyed. I recommend going on Tuesday for taco Tuesday. Tacos start at $2 and they have drink specials for their house margaritas and Tecate. This place is a cozy little restaurant with a nice outdoor seating area. Everything our table ordered was pretty good but I think it's worth noting that the ceviche was $14 which seems a little steep for a small appetizer. Overall, the food and service was pretty good. I may return for another taco Tuesday  Pictured is the outside area and the carnitas tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

n_BXASN4NgSkiS9_uxPx6A.text: Nice little Mexican Restaurant... Very authentic which means no Beef or Chicken Fajitas...The Alambre Ribeye Tacos are delicious a little small though, wish they were a tad bigger...and the salsa was really watered down...

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alambre Ribeye Soft Tacos! They&#39;re delicious!

VbazaY2wY04ciqA8vmGORg.text: New ownership and food is awesome. So glad they bought out that hag of an owner that was here. It has a whole new vibe and the food is amazing. Patio is the best.

-VvUBEqTSeRNLxjqURtHMw.text: We enjoyed this restaurant at the recommendation of a good friend.  Started with the Vamos Don Margarita.  Then, ordered a second.  I decided a third would be a bad decision no matter how good they were.  My wife enjoyed the Cadillac Margarita but tried my Vamos Don and switched for the second round.  The Cadillac is excellent.  Free chips and two excellent house made salsas kept the margarita's company.  We shared ceviche for a starter.  A unique presentation and was excellent.  Will order again.  My wife had the smoked chicken enchilada while I had the carnitas plate.  Quality was great and flavors wonderful.  Adam, the owner, spent a few minutes with us.  His pride in the restaurant was genuine, we felt very welcome and are sure to return soon, possibly tomorrow.

ZQ7XDu06b0MtCpfgJUUdrA.text: Food 4/5 , vegetarian and vegan options 5/5, parking and seating 5/5.  Solid food, creamy corn appetizer was delicious, ceviche was fancy, vegan enchiladas was solid, margaritas had good amount of alcohol. All in all would return.

yVUTTZQyXcC_PAc_82044Q.text: This was a family run restaurant. I went there with a large group and everyone enjoyed their meal. The chili rellano and the lamb seemed to be the favorites at the table.

w-WNsOibi42zFMoJ41VQ1Q.text: THANK YOU for offering vegan options, so hard to find at other Mexican restaurants! The vegan enchilada was delish as were the guacamole, beans, rice and salsa! Excellent service as well.

Wp_pjSGKL8o2Kzu2lVJGIw.text: I drove 30 min there to try it out only to get waved down to leave the parking lot. Apparently they had a special event going on. Would have been nice if they put that out there. No even a sign at the entrance. Not a great first impression

XR9xlo68URP7d_JYnBedrA.text: Their pork pozole sopa is really good. I had no appetite because of sickness but I still almost finished it. The corns in it really add to the texture. Tortilla soup was a bit bland with its chicken noodle soup like taste. I would come back to try other food here

HM0TooGtoPHXOAZXIGdleQ.text: Excellent Mexican restaurant!! Great service sweet homey feel inside and a lovely patio. The food was gourmet but not pretentious just creative with delicious flavors. The chicken tamales were amazing and my husband got the steak meal that was just so flavorful. My tamale meal was a delicious lunch the next day too! Great portions and price. Omg the chocolate ice cream is home made and delicious don't pass that up it was a real treat after an excellent meal!! Now I'm hungry and want to go back ASAP ohh good margs too!!

5eevUlYNZuxW1-L1FRKxQw.text: Seafood cheese dip was like cat food and Ribeye soft tacos were like dog food. I'm not a fan, my husband loves it..

nCTOqbExdMHPtIED4g3MOw.text: Brunched here with a friend.  Outstanding atmosphere, service, and some of the best Mex food I've had in the area.  Will go again. . .many times.

aoPnex_Inxngsttc9rG9kA.text: I am in Pennsylvania and needed to find a restaurant that would deliver food to a gathering for a family member that passed away in Scottsdale.  Geoff and his staff were extremely helpful and helped a bad day become a bit better with a delicious meal.  I understand the food was delicious and highly recommend trying this establishment because when I do go to the Phoenix/Scottsdale area I will go to this restaurant.  Thank you Geoff, you have a great team.

1YeyOqIY3X-adMphxaSbIA.text: Quite enjoyed the atmosphere and authentic Mexican food. The Quesadillas were tremendous. The pork entree was also quite nice. Moreover the southwestern hospitality was appreciated. The owner was as friendly as can be. Recommended!  Rob Baker Hamilton Ontario, Canada.

Za-gpX3WGP1lFGLZV1IYfg.text: Wonderful clean spot. Not your normal Mexican food, this place has some flare and uniqueness. Excellent service.

Bp0w1LdSDo6P4hKdcPU_bg.text: We absolutely love Los Sombreros. The staff, food, and drinks are consistently wonderful. The new owners are present, friendly, and truly love their staff, restaurant, and customers. We continue to return over and over!

zSDFbgeEpInJBJTfdbBuxQ.text: We have gone here for years. Food tonight was very poor. Service was good. Environment very old and dated. Unfortunately went when it was still light. Server cleaned our table, but it still was sticky. Food: "signature guacamole" was very small and "blah". Beans tasted as if they were right out of the can, rice was very old and totally cold! Very sad! It used to be very good to excellent.

xDHPcoysfY2qSw2JCTGoeA.text: This is an updated review since the new ownership took over a week ago, and it's a night and day difference. The atmosphere was electric, service was spectacular, and food was on point. We are thrilled that this neighborhood gem is back and better than ever!

25rnPphpGnOnhnpXo_ltKA.text: Wow, we just had lunch here and we were both pleasantly surprised at the attentive service, fabulous food and reasonable price!  Great place for lunch, will have to try dinner soon.

m_fFkvpm_9-bjglZzOttYg.text: Definitely a "Must Go" place! Great decor & atmosphere with friendly service. Although we dined inside, the outdoor patio with cooling mist sprayers made it very inviting. The FOOD WAS FABULOUS! From the crispy thin chips and delicious just-right-spicy salsa before the meal (along with the scrumptous guacamole) to the large, beautifully presented entrees, all was very tasty.  I had the Carnitas with my 2 choices of black beans and veggies. Meat was tender and flavorful, beans good (I liked that they were served separately in a small cup), and don't skip the veggies! They were a great combination that have a delicate grilled flavor. EVERYTHING WAS SO GOOD! My husband thoroughly enjoyed his Tamale with refried beans and rice. I didn't get to taste but it was beautifully plated and he loved it. Our entrees were served with tortillas. Lots of food.  I'm sure you'll love Los Sombreros too!

FkUtxOKzwQ8os0nJJX6TiA.text: Loved the food and service, they have options for vegetarians. Got the hibiscus tacos, huitlacoche crepes and potato goat cheese enchilada. All three were pretty good.

tlhE0qWUZ8xWlo3X-5VKHA.text: Food was mediocre. Ordered flan for dessert.  Not bad but nothing special.  Service was not very good. They did they they were short staffed as waiter called in sick.    Ice cream on the menu was not available.  Would not recommend and won't go back.  Just too many other Mexican restaurants to choose from.

md7XrT1N6iSxgOd-t3bS5w.text: Excellent food, atmosphere and service. The owner came by our table a couple of times and was very patient with us as he answered our questions and made recommendations. My wife and I had the guacamole, fish tacos and puerco en chipotle and all were unbelievable good. The service was first rate and the owner came by our table a couple of times to ensure our experience was great....and it was! It was obvious the owner has a passion for great food and for his customers. His staff reflect the same attitude as well.   We decided to set in the dining room but there is a lovely patio as well that looked very inviting.

J0R6bLUe_Uh0pGAg9hON8A.text: This place was FANTASTIC!!!!! Came from out of town to watch son race ASU, brought large family - food & service was tremendous. Honestly, across the board (even the kids loved it) can't say anything bad, the entire place was great!

AEjJdjg_uegzneHgT1KvFA.text: Remax happy hour! Great place- new owners! Food amazing- try house specialties Pollo con Espinaca tacos or puerco en mole verde tacos. Guac is amazing!  Will be back for more happy hours - outdoor patio is great during winter months! Thanks Kurt, Jeff & Rosie!!!

7CGaa2ef_yuxmXEEQhWLNw.text: Unfortunately, Los Sombreros has gone downhill over the years. The food has lost flavor, the bar area is cluttered and the owner can always be heard yelling at and criticizing her staff. The poor servers are so scared to mess up they provide for an uncomfortable, unwarm atmosphere.   I suggest considering one of the many other pleasant Mexican food restaurants.

idJ59qHtw227YYtgKRztiw.text: Great food great price. We ate here 10 years ago and now that we moved back to Scottsdale we wanted to try it again. It's under new ownership now. We started with margaritas and they were great, believe me we are fussy. They aren't too sweet and they put booze in them. We got the guacamole, nice and chunky. I had seafood tacos and the others had the steak and enchilada. We loved our meals. The seafood was flavorful and not fried. We will be back soon!!

SqoTZGiCzLt5YTK98sbmlw.text: This is not your traditional Mexican fare but it is very good.  Came here with a large group.  Everyone left talking about how good their entree was.  Very good flavors.  Service was great.  A bit pricy but worth it.

Ng8nwLf-m0-gAO_DunGQOw.text: A recent Yelp Elite event led me to this place which is actually in my neighborhood, just blocks from home. I can't believe I've never stopped in here before the event.  I have been here twice since the Yelp event and enjoyed both visits. You can't go wrong with chips and guac. Their salsa is a tasty chipotle. But I have to say their shrimp ceviche is probably the best I've had in a while.  I've also tried a few of their tacos and they're really good. As for drinks, I've had the Steve-a-Rita and the Cadillac, both of which I would recommend. I did try the Paloma and would not order it again but only because of the Tajin, just not my thing. Having said that, I will definitely continue visiting this establishment, as the food is great and the service is too. The drinks are wowza!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The best ceviche! And my drink is the Cadillac. Of course.

EgTiQkYRqJLE_r3FtzlYbw.text: Recently discovered this restaurant located just south of old town Scottsdale. Really great place to have brunch or some happy hour drinks and appetizers. Great fun in a small but comfy setting. They also have a really nice outdoor bar area with more seating outside than inside.  Extensive margarita menu so you will be able to either drink a classic or discover something new. Don't miss out on checking out the bathroom doors, really cool!!

Gd8xcaBJmPP_mAHrCR2TPg.text: If I could give ten stars I would.  Where to begin? Okay the hand made margaritas (Steve-a-rita and Coco Loco) we're well made and balanced.  Fresh chips and salsa, not that boring tomato puree, but a nice house made chipotle salsa and hot crispy chips.   I had the ribeye, my GF had the crab enchiladas.  Rice and beans were spot on as was the guacamole.  Seasoning on my steak was nothing less than perfect, tender and flavorful, cooked slightly more than requested, but so tender and delicious, I could not fault it at all.   When I saw pecan pie on the dessert menu, I knew we had to try it, unfortunately they were out, so instead David (our amazing server) brought us hot house made churros with homemade ice cream.  Words can't describe how good that was.   We have a new favorite. Can't wait to come back and try another amazing dish.  And they take reservations!!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steve-a-rita and coco loco
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Coco loco margarita
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ribeye and cheese enchilada

gWj8i9BUoYxQWF4r6DhAJQ.text: Stopped in for lunch the other day and had the best food and the best service! My friend and I each had a delicious margarita, she had the vegan enchiladas and I had the Chile relleno. The food was excellent and the place is adorable. Definitely worth checking out and I will be back!

WAHN7a9JvthAilAZiPK8pg.text: A True valley gem.  This authentic restaurant had charm and class to go along with their house margaritas.  With not just one, but two chefs, their creative creations will whisk you to the mountains of Mexico City where tortillas were invented.    Enjoy a cool outdoor experience with their tropical misters and sneak a drink at the hidden bar if you dare.

jkDZBFfKuuahOQvzMS_-rA.text: The drink is amazing , stevira drink was fun   They actually use patron tequila and the decoration on it is making it fun.  The guacamole is so fresh and nice. Like it was the actual avocado. I am still new in Phoenix area but I bet if there is any guacamole contest they would win :)  The shrimp cocktail was amazing so delicious . I've never tried anything like that before. Amazing shrimps , everything so fresh and simply delicious.  The beef was so delicious. I think most think I love about this place is of course the delicious fresh food but also the amazing attitude of the owner and his waitress/ bartenders .   Jaritza was amazing waitress , she was smiling all the time and really took care of us. Which was a bonus , I love it when I go to a place and get amazing service . I enjoy the food much more when I see the friendly and nice waiters/waitress.  It was a long time since I was in a place that the food was delicious with a great atmosphere and wonderful attitude . Everything is just amazing. I highly suggested to go there have a drink and food :)
