FMQVZEzEm_rJStLvNMJL_g.text: I had high hopes for this place because heard a lot of good things. Service was good and was seated right away even though I would recommend reservations. I had Chicken Mole and it was super bland so very disappointed in that, also had a steak taco and also bland. I guess I'm use to more authentic Mexican food, this place is good for the masses but if looking for authentic food this isn't the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

GCItj6q9S4Ty9eH1e5BQeQ.text: We started with drinks. The margaritas are all made fresh. We came for the jalapeno margarita. Omg must get this!! Now I don't do spicy so my husband got this and I tried it. It was so good!! The flavor is there and the spice is only for a moment. I had the pomegranate margarita and the mango margarita, both very delicious.  To eat we had the jicama and orange salad, which my husband described as a vegan ceviche lol. Was very delicious and the Queso fundido with spinach. That was very good as well. The atmosphere is really cool too it's very comfortable and clean. Actually took us back for a moment when we were in Akumal Mexico. Definitely a new favorite of ours. Very excited to go back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jicama and mango salad
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pomegranate margarita

MknnRzemOEqgjv0eVUJUUA.text: We had heard lots about this place & decided this is where we wanted to celebrate Cinco de Mayo.  They were having a special on house ritas for $5.  I ordered a Patron Blanco rita for $7!  Wow!  great start, have often do you find good drinks under $10?   We started with the guacamole.  Boo got the Green Corn Tamales w/ the veggies & refried beans for sides.  I got the Pollo con Espinacas, grilled chicken breast with house made chipotle cream topped with cilantro cream, tomato and onions!  WOW!  so darn yummy!!    The place was super crowded which we expected but we were seated immediately since we had reservations!  It's very casual and there's outdoor seating too.  We look forward to returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. POLLO CON ESPINACAS
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. GREEN CORN TAMALES

EjIHz6LGIx4Ot_wmYaQRxA.text: This is my new favorite Mexican food restaurant.  I came for lunch on Wednesday and it was so good went Thursday for dinner. Fresh chips and salsa. Chicken taco and flauta with rice and refried beans. The Carnitas was wonderful and the refried beans were so good. Met one of the owners Geoff. Great customer service nice neighborhood restaurant.  Can't wait to go for brunch and happy hour.

Z0ILJRG6pwaKK0wvlx0eMQ.text: I am a bit disappointed with this place, my husband and I came here a few nights ago because he has been wanting to come here for awhile. We pulled into the driveway and were impressed with the cute bar area on the back corner. It was made out of an old shipping container and had lights hung up in the trees around it.   We walked around the front, thinking the entrance was there but we ended up walking back to the back, and actually had to go through the back patio seating and through the kitchen, which was odd.   As we were waiting to be seated we were talking about it, and how it was our first time here, and as we walked to our table multiple servers asked us about it being our first time and were shocked. Odd, but okay - we sat in the dining room inside and it was very cramped, we had to weave through the tables and were sat by the back windows. Our waitress and I'm assuming trainee since he was not introduced, were very kinda and gave us recommendations for their favorite dishes.   When we received our beer order, it was very warm which was disappointing as it was a hot day. Our food came fairly quickly, and looked great. Although to our surprise was very bland. It seemed to have no seasoning, and tasted very bare minimum, which didn't seem to follow the hype that the waiters were giving. My husband liked his meal more than I, but we both agreed we may at one point in the future try this place again. Everyone's experience is different.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Enchilada de la Plaza
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

9x0g9sQ8c4I-TxwDOTaBXg.text: I'm really torn on this one. I haven't been here in a very long time.   I had some vague recollection of the pricing and something I had previously tasted not being in line with my taste buds.   It was midday, I was starving and the place is close by and often packed. So, I decided to give it another go. My memory of the pricing was accurate, as was my taste bud recollection.   It wasn't too busy so we were seated very quickly. We were also brought chips, salsa and water very quickly. One thing for certain is our server was attentive.   My friend ordered the cuba libre, I ordered the agua frescas. No complaints on the drinks, at all.   But, of course, of course I ordered the same thing. I didn't realize this until my first bite. What do I normally go to? The vegan options. Always.   I ordered the vegan enchilada. The vegan cheese had me do a double take at the menu because it was creamy and deliciously deceptive (tasting like actual cheese). However, I just simply do not enjoy the enchilada sauce. It's a personal preference I'm sure but it to me, is a bit on the bitter side. It's almost like my salsa roja before I add lime and a wee bit of sugar. It's bitter burnt, something. I'm not sure. The veggies on the side were cooked well. My friend had the carnitas soft tacos and had no complaints at all but he found them smaller than expected (they're street taco size).   I'm determined at this point to try again and to just stay away from the enchiladas... now that I remember.

V8O7tY_WSHW699o_U2qnXw.text: Our server was so nice!! We sat outside it was beautiful, although a little dark once the sun went down. The table was a little uneven. I was on the end so I thought some of my plates were going to fall off. Food was good. Drinks were strong.

oXiBlTr1BbfRV3rRJmJA7Q.text: As others have stated, Los Sombreros is a cute place off Scottsdale and Virginia. A co-worker was looking for a tamale to satisfy a craving, and I Yelped this joint. She got a chicken tamale and the Mexican chocolate pie.   My co-worker enjoyed her tamale. I tasted it, and it was good, but nothing to write home about. The sauce on top, however, was an extremely tasty tomatillo. The Mexican chocolate pie was great. It was a huge hunk, so it was intimidating, as one could imagine the heavy, frosting-like chocolate. After stealing a bite of that too, I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was very light...similar to a mousse. The flavor was good, but not as "cinnamony" as I would have hoped. Note that the meal also was served with salsa and a large gratis bag of chips.  Cut to today. My other friend and I decided to try this place out, being that our co-worker had been our taste-tester.  First of all, those who know me need only see this: ONLINE ORDERING!   We ordered online, noting that the process was very user-friendly. Upon arrival for pick-up, I noted that the restaurant was cute. It smelled of wonderful fire and food. The bar was cute, with nice wood and brickwork. The patio was fairly large, and was also nice. The hostess stand was between the bar and patio. Our order was to be picked up at the bar.  Our order was not yet ready, so we waited a few minutes. The owner came out and chatted us up, noting what folks like on the menu, and thanking us for coming in for a try. He was very nice.  Our food and drink came out in quality packaging and a brown bag. We did have to ask for chips and salsa, so that was a bit awkward. But he took care of us, and got a small container of super firey salsa for my gal pal.  My meal: Hibiscus tea. I guess I was expecting something else, but this was straight up jamaica. Not bad. Average. I ordered a green corn tamale with veggies and refried beans. The tamale was the highlight of the meal. It was prepared well, aesthetically pretty in service, and in that aforementioned fantastic tomatillo sauce. The veggies were just about julienne, and were a bit aldente for me. The refried beans were standard, and maybe even a little chunky for me.  Her meal: Chicken tacos with rice and beans. The rice had no flavor, and was very dry. She also found the refried beans standard. For the tacos, she opted for flour tortillas. They were very small, and she said that the chicken tasted oddly boiled. She also noted that two flour tacos cost the same as 3 corn tacos.  The chips: Pretty good. The bag was large.   The salsas: Hot: Super firey hot, but no flavor.                      Standard: A bit watery, pretty bland.                      Chipotle: My friend likened the taste to the smell of bandaids. I did NOT like this salsa.  I may return and try something else, but I'm not rushing to come back.

1Tx4zL12BbU0E8RuNz6a2w.text: I love this place for their Ambience. They have a beautiful patio seating place under the shade of a huge tree, which makes it a bit easier to dine outside even in Arizona summers. Also, people who work here are so welcoming.  My favourite is their Michelada (A Mexican drink made with beer, lime juice, assorted sauces (often chili-based), spices, tomato juice, and chili peppers served in a chilled, salt-rimmed glass).  Also their Smoked chicken soft tacos, Potato Tacos, Guacamole and creamy Esquites were yummy.  My 5-star rating is purely for the Ambience and Micheladas:)

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Michelada with Dos Equis Beer. Couldn&#39;t find it in the menu but you can ask them and they make it.

281LKUavu8bdlJ54ENA-oQ.text: This is a really cute restaurant with a great patio attached. The ambiance is top-notch. I'd recommend checking out the menu first though to see if it aligns with what you're looking for in a Mexican place. My teen son was with us, and he just wanted some simple burritos or a quesadilla. They don't offer burritos and the quesadilla was a foodie's dream! (Mexican truffle, goat cheese, etc.) If you like more inventive Mexican food, then you're set here. If you're my teenaged son, not so much!  I enjoyed my chicken soft tacos. Every ingredient was good quality and tasty. My husband got Pechuga Rellena. (Grilled chicken breast stuffed with mushrooms and goat cheese.) He was totally in his element, loving the unique ingredients and flavors. All of us (my son included) loved the chips and salsa that were brought out first. I'd like to come back and try another menu item.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My chicken soft tacos, sans cabbage - delicious!
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Super cute interior - reminds me of restaurants in the Bay Area

lTEqOiKwP1pU_kR0gmBwvQ.text: Okay, so the margaritas and guacamole were to die for. This location is very quaint and had a nice outdoor patio with misters as it is HOT. Granted, I wouldn't be bringing my pup here as it's too hot still in the afternoon. However, I saw one other person with a dog there. We liked our server who was efficient and attentive. However we were slightly disappointed in how long our dinner took in coming out. I guess the kitchen got way way behind? When it did finally come, it was tasty. He enjoyed his enchilada and I enjoyed my salad. Overall, we would go back as it was fun. The only down side was we were starving by the time the food came out. Parking is behind and around the side of this location. They do take reservations, so make one if you want to sit inside. Not a lot of seating inside. The patio isn't terrible with the misters on though.

N09rjHkrvlQ70sXeGZBrmg.text: My wife and I were really excited to try Los Sombreros. We went early on a Thursday evening to Happy Hour and dinner. I'm Celiac and need gluten-free and this place has LOTS of options for those looking for gluten-free.  Their happy hour prices were pretty good and the house margarita was solid for a standard margarita. We also got the queso rajas, al pastor tacos and guacamole all from the happy hour menu. The guacamole was very good but the queso and al pastor tacos left a lot to be desired. The flavor on the tacos was ok but they were relatively dry.  For dinner, I got the Puerco en Mole Verde and my wife had the Smoked Chicken Enchiladas. The Puerco en Mole was ok flavor wise and the presentation was good, but I wouldn't get it again. The smoked chicken enchiladas were just ok as well and my wife said she wouldn't order them again.  Overall it was very much a so-so experience and we may give it a try again because they have so many gluten-free options, but won't be our first choice given all the great food in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smoked Chicken Enchiladas with refried beans and veggies - just ok, nothing special
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Puerco en Mole Verde - meh, wouldn&#39;t get again

j_fFQ6WvX-tMl9Tn1aXmgg.text: Always  a great experience at Los Sombreros! The food and service have been constantly fantastic every time we go. We highly recommend this place.

hmt-DTn7JYx4tfJ4YCPT3Q.text: Great food! Our first round of beers were warm, and it took a long long time to get the second round as we feel like our server forgot about us. Food was food however.

tVV7yG8XwdiGXxTrhpSTKQ.text: Thought we would try this place on recommendation from a taxi driver . The chili rellenos were DELICIOUS! One would have been plenty but you are served TWO! The beans and rice were also very good . Let's back up though ! We started with guacamole . It was simple and chunky and tasty . Like REAL authentic Mexican guacamole. Husband ordered the carnititas and stated they were the best he had ever had . He cooks carnitas at home and he said these were better than his . The margaritas were a little different and very very good . Service , excellent . The owner come to the table to see how we were doing . We have been visiting Scottsdale a week and this was easily the best meal we had . This is a must visit when in the area !

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jicama and orange salad . Refreshing and tasty .
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Two traditional chili rellanos. And ... on another plate ,you are served beans and rice .

GpSb5KvNhkrJLzLSfdMgXQ.text: I have to wonder if these good reviews are relatives of the owners of this place! EEEKKK WORST MEXICAN FOOD IN THIS AREA!  Met some others for lunch there.  Lunch time & literally no one else in there (bad sign).  Located in a very popular area but no one else there!  Waiter brings menu with dried food bits on it, yuk.  Six at our table & no one liked their food!  Tacos overloaded big time with white onions, meat tasted watered down with little spice, rice was disgusting, even ice tea sucked!  Couldn't eat anything after tasting a piece of the meat & one bite of rice!  Told the waiter food stinks & they still charged full price!  Don't go here!  Julio's Too is just right down the road from here & it has great food!

tD3QYLTWbc6sOGf73E2dAQ.text: We came here with 10 ppl, and had no problem making reservations on a Saturday night. Service was excellent, and the food was spot on! Loved the ambience of this place. Would definitely return if I were back in Scottsdale.   My only complaint is the pricing. I found it a tad high. The food was good, yes, but 18-25$ good? I feel I've eaten just as well for cheaper. I guess you're paying for the "feel" of the place as well.

POW-tLTCK3MUj1OT7GfZ1A.text: Excellent food!! Nothing like typical southwestern fare. Everything was obviously made from scratch. The sauces were amazing and the smoky flavor of the meats delicious. The staff was super friendly and their recommendations spot on. We will definitely be back.

77eHaRFqcfpxvs3MQoz6DQ.text: Went here after seeing a positive review in Phoenix magazine. Did not disappoint ! We had the chorizo and black bean queso - seriously, possibly the best appetizer I have ever had. We both ordered rather eccentric sounding main dishes. I actually was presented a different meal than I had asked for, but when I tried it, it didn't matter! Everything about this place is great - the indoor seating area is small but great furniture and chandelier gallery. The outdoor area is nice too. Staff friendly and timely. Definitely coming back again.

5z8bIlzP5yhhEIBGI7kbJA.text: This was our first visit. The ambiance was comfortable although they don't have booths which we prefer. We eat at a table 6 nights a week and enjoy a booth when eating out. We wish more restaurants used them, but they probably take up more valuable floor space or are more expensive. The building appeared to be a home conversion. The service was adequate. The food had a unique take which is a prerequisite in a city of predominately Mexican restaurants. The reason for the lost star is the price points. Two smoked chicken, the uniqueness, enchiladas for $15 isn't competitive with our usual places. Don Ruben's has combination dinners for $9.95 the last time we visited and the online menu states. Don't you hate it when the online prices don't match the menu upon arrival? They also have decent parking for Scottsdale and a beckoning patio which we didn't take advantage of because of temperature. Worth a try, but we probably won't return.

xHcxDk45USKz1lt1K0ERCA.text: The chocolate ice cream is to die for.  Guacamole is very good.  Authentic Mexican food.  Staff was very nice.  Great meal.

SdPK0bzLWrgh2sbH8eZIBg.text: I would recommend you try Los Sombreros.  While many other restaurants in the area have so so food that is overpriced, Los Sombreros is high quality, delicious food at the right price.   Portions were right on.   I like the location because it's just outside the craziness and traffic of old town Scottsdale, but it only takes a minute to drive there from Old Town (parking was a cinch).   I went for lunch: service was snappy, the tacos were amazing, and it didn't break the bank.  They have available patio seating in a fun atmosphere.   PS- you HAVE TO try the mountain of guacamole with your chips. Very fresh and flavorful.

RR4K0hQCS9LGEvCV8ocSbQ.text: Really good place with excellent food! Seems like a mom and pop owned place, which I really liked. The staff were super friendly and very helpful with the menu. I recommend the smoked chicken enchilada! Very tasty! Great bang for your buck... lots of food for a fair price. Highly recommend!

hJ_0mvljqyrfqNX9z_THWA.text: This was a great find. Los Sombreros has excellent service and tasty food. They are also gluten free friendly. Los Sombreros has a welcoming ambience. I really liked how they offer veggies as a side dish.

XbKKN74qnIXlS4MXSIRb-w.text: Celebrating a family event,  Rosie our  waitress was very attentive to everything that we need for a very large family  Celebration, the food was delicious,  not to mention the  Margaritas are the best.... I would recommend it to all..

67X9pcOce_QVTYb0wjoPwg.text: This little Mexican place has a great happy hour and wonderful service. The food was great and our server Yolanda made the experience very pleasant. Will definitely return.

0npkCn_Krxm-P5L8bNUdqw.text: We made a reservation, arrived on time and were seated no problem. We then sat at our table for over 15 minutes and not one person acknowledged us. There were three servers working and two empty tables. Not sure what happened. When we were leaving, we told the hostess what happened and she just dismissed us. Very disappointing.

w2GdSwzlb6sdp2rPt7AdYQ.text: It is quite a disappointment when you feel like you're inconveniencing a place to be dining in there. From the time we first sat down to the time we left, I almost felt guilty for being there and making them take my order or bring my food out. This shouldn't ever be the case. After being sat, it took about 5 mins to get the menu, then another 5-10 to get a water, then another 5-10 to have our chips brought out. When ordering I told our waitress that I couldn't have dairy and asked to substitute guacamole for the cheese and sour cream. At first she told me they can't do that. I asked if they could charge me the difference or whatever since I can't have dairy and would like that in place. When she brought out the food, my side of guacamole was covered in cheese. I wanted to say something to our waitress but she never came back by. After being finished with our meal, we waited for our server to come back by, but she never did. After about 20 mins of waiting and noticing she came to the other two tables outside but not ours, I waited another 10 mins and finally resorted to going in and asking the manager for our bill. His only response was they got an unexpected rush of people coming in. The main dish was pretty good, but the sides were more bland. It was a very uncomfortable dining experience sadly.

1hFOeX8vCkA7xeXq764QDA.text: The service and food was amazing and excellent!! The only issue we had which is why it's only 4 stars is because as we were leaving we saw our waiter (who happened to be in the kitchen) was filling up chip baskets with bare hands. That's a huge turn off and made us never want to eat the chips again.

SP3j70DZeY2RpFLyELer8A.text: Terrific tasting mexican food with great service.  My wife and I ate there on Superbowl sunday around 3:30. We had the guacamole appetizer a bowl of posole and the Carnitas dinner. The guac was plentiful and delicious and came with plenty of tasty chips. We each sampled the posole and the Carnitas and both agreed they were excellent. Our waiter was also outstanding and even allowed us to taste a few of their draft beers. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone as it is clearly a cut above the rest. I also thought their prices were very reasonable for all the food we received.

T_RN1N8ROGGPgHtab12qEQ.text: Guac is 'towering' and super yummy. I had the red beef tamale. Very good, large portion, definitely don't need to order anything else. And they have an option for sauteed veggies as a side which is a great alternative to other unwanted carbs. Black beans are great too!

QX8S9N1t5OhT8vzmcQ-QQQ.text: Authentic, flavorful, inventive... delicious!!!!  Food quality is 5 stars. Service was wonderful too. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb shank was delicious!

2mMSxfu26LULeKqMuwqB3Q.text: Great place, friendly staff, great patio. The best part was that the staff was knowledgeable and helpful regarding food allergies and what to avoid on menus for gluten and dairy sensitivities, as our family has severe ones. The good news is none of us got sick. Yay!!

_cHOo_Y8n34L4SZyhozHbg.text: The food was great and the service was even better. My family went herein a whim and boy was it good. The owner even came out and talked to us. We will be coming back.

sQQzxvhP528bInBTSPakHQ.text: My girlfriend and I ate here during Phoenix Restaurant week.  We had rapid and friendly service.    We had 3 courses and my girlfriend had a Margarita.  Everything had the gooey deliciousness that I expect from Mexican food.   The Chile Colorado had a lot of spice, so come ready for a lot of powerful flavor!

A_70y0cTkB1uAblcqauLfg.text: simply put, I think this is the best Mex restaurant in the valley.  At least of all the ones I have eaten at.  Get the guac salad.  SO GOOD!!!  Also the mole sauce is to die for and even better their pork in chipotle sauce.  In fact I have eaten their many many times and had nothing less than an exceptional meal.  LOVE IT!

d_5W8sWwbA03NVF-mGLYvw.text: If there was a negative star I would hit it at least 20 times  We went for lunch @ 2oo  ock - i usually go for happy hour a appetizer....but this time I went with my whole family (six)  we all decided to just get a "quick appetizer" -  three tacos each and two sides of guacamole.  The tacos tortilla was smaller than my hand and with only four pieces of meat...the guacamolee was filledwith cabage on thebottom to make it look big and tons of onions....I was forced to scoop  out one huge spoon fulled of guacamole because a flie sat on top of it.  We were there for 20 min ....remember we were in a rush...but when we got the bill $135.00   they include a twenty dollar tip !!! Cannot belief I paide $135.00 for 18 tacos....and a two soda drinks...  NEVER GOING BACK....at night my feet were huge guess the meat was toooo salty.....

bhtpM9OZOwDOYzeVQA7Isw.text: Los Sombreros is one of my favorite restaurants in the valley. The food is always just perfect. The prices are extremely reasonable. I modeled my own guacamole recipe after theirs, it's that good. Try the specials of the day, they're always great.   The service has been a little hit & miss for me. Most of the time they're fine. There's this one woman who is extremely unfriendly. I think she just doesn't like me :-) But ya know, with food & ambiance like this, it doesn't bother me if I occasionally end up with a cranky server!

_u9Xh34x8Eeu8hisKeo3AQ.text: My husband was having some Mexican cravings one night, and as we always try to do to try a new place, we decided to try Los Sombreros which is only a few miles from home. As we pulled in the parking lot, we were surprised how packed the lot is so we thought this was a good choice. At the reception area, we got greeted and seated right away. Service is quite good as glasses with water and menu were handed as we take our seats. A basket of freshly made chips with mild salsa was served as we take time finding a good meal to choose. As we scan the two-page menu, we found the selection to be minimal and somewhat overpriced with only a few items costing to at least less than $10 and the rest within the range of $10-20. The chips and salsa were good enough that we asked for another serving without knowing that this will be charged, it was actually on the menu that per refill costs. Not a good thing I guess. We decided on Simmered pork in a pumpkinseed tomatillo mole sauce, presentation is nice but nothing really special as we take bites of it. It's an entree that comes with choices of refried beans, black beans, rice or vegetables and tortilla. The only thing that made my husband happy with the meal was the hot salsa that really made him sweat like he has never sweat before from eating hot salsa!   Overall, the experience didn't leave us happy and will not try to come back here again though I would rate the ambiance and decor high as it is inviting and homey.

fKm97D637sl_gL55MOT1zg.text: The best mexican I've ever had, hands down. I've been to all the hyped places; Z'Tejas, Chevy's, Gardunos, Macayos, Tia Rosas, Carlsbad Tavern, Blue Adobe, Arribas, Salty Senoria (horrible), Pink Taco (deplorable). The food here is as quality as I've had with mexican.   I find many mexican places give you little taste with a heavy supply of starch and cheese. Their Carnitas and Lamb Chop are slow roasted and bursting with flavor. Margarita and salsa selection leaves a little to be desired, but this place is a can't miss. Save room for dessert, because the Mexican chocolate cream pie is simply amazing.  Alright I'm cutting back to 4 stars, the plates are great, but the margaritas could be better, and the chips and salsa leaves something to be desired.

qhaC5nMrClp-XDzSJ4LcmQ.text: I hadn't been here for a couple of years but remembered how good it was the other day when I passed by.  I was dubious of some of the reviews based on my experience, but hey, that was like I said a couple of years ago.  What my girlfriend and I experienced was fantastic food, wonderful service and just as I remembered it, a great atmosphere.  I had a tasty margarita, just the classic.  We ordered the guacamole to compliment our chips and salsa; which by the way comes with two salsas, one that is chunky and sweet with a small hint of heat, the other seemed to be tomatillo based and was equally good.  The guacamole was just as I remembered, chunky and delicious.  My girlfriend tried the Enchiladas de pollo.  She loved the flavor of the smoked chicken.  I had Puerco en Chipotle, which is slow roasted pork in a tomatillo-chipotle sauce.  It was darn good.  I didn't eat to much of my sides because I had consumed so much guacamole and the pork was just too good!  We were there on a Saturday night about 1900 and were seated immediately on the patio.  Our server was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive.  Overall fantastic, just as I remembered.  Sure you may have to park on the street (we did); no worries, it's a great place.  Buen provecho

8vHMKtB5HEu0Za1T6LVVBw.text: Went with a groupon - Probably the most disappointed i have been with one.  I am not sure what I had as it did not resemble what I had ordered (I thought anyway) and it was tasteless.  I just wanted to be done and really did not want to order anything else.  I have tried many Mexican restaurants in the valley and this has been my only disappointment, normally I am pleasantly surprised.  Sorry folks.

Na26B73Yaz-ZwhhiPR_L-g.text: Was in Scottsdale on business and this was recommended as a good spot to bring our group from the office. We sat outside and it was really nice, the atmosphere was comfy and the music wasn't blasting so you could actually hear the people at your table.  Everyone in our party seemed happy with their meals. The guacamole was terrific and we all enjoyed our drinks (I had the white sangria which was pretty good). The food however was a little uneven. I had the crab enchiladas which were tasty but the sauce was so spicey it could have been any kind of meat in there. My friend has a chicken mole dish and she said the mole sauce was absolutely perfect. Someone had the shrimp cocktail which came in a gigantic glass, which was kind of funny (he said it was alright but didn't eat much of it).   I liked it enough to give it another shot next time I'm there.

MGUbYMPx_-n5k4dpXW_jRg.text: This restaurant is outstanding! I have been here more times then I can count. The margaritas are delicious (I get a strawberry blended margarita) as well as the food. My two suggestions would be to always get the guacamole for an appetizer and then the smoked chicken enchiladas for the entree.

_eHeum_9S1R39CtrNaX_vQ.text: Tried this place because of a groupon.  Good thing it was at a discount, because it was not worth the money.  While the location and building are very authentic and unique for the area, that is about all this place has going for it.  I can't give a mexican restaurant a good review when they charge for chips and salsa, especially when the salsa is below average.  I ordered the smoked chicken enchiladas and was disappointed.  First the waitress messed up my order.  I clearly said I wanted the beans and rice, this is a mexican restaurant, right?  For some reason my mexican food comes out with grilled seasonal vegetables and black beans.  Umm...ok.  I didn't complain, bc I didn't want to wait any longer for my food.  But this is definitely a first.  Overall, the enchiladas lacked flavor and the tortillas were hard.    I will not return.

RyhIoEgFGUrloWCV2_sFfg.text: The atmosphere at this place is awesome.  Very appropriate for a Mexcian restsraunt.   The food was amazing,  try the Lamb Adobo & Puerco in Chipotle ... they will rock your socks off.   The service was great as well.

u5-gM6PRh67NxMP1fKHszw.text: I visited here for lunch one day with some friends of mine.  The service was fairly standard and the food was pretty good.  It seemed clean enough and I had the Tijuana Donkey.  Pretty good.

9a429h-XkF2ZzZsQQYzE0Q.text: I've become a regular here, and I actually begin to miss this place if I go more than a couple of weeks without a visit.  It isn't so much that the ambiance readily engages or celebrates Mexican spirit and charm (it doesn't), or that seating is otherwise comfortable and spacious (it can be tight and some inside tables sit high).  But the food is amazing, the margaritas are my favorites anywhere, and the service has been excellent (with one rare exception when it seemed to take exorbitantly long for our waitress to initially appear).    I'm one of those rare individuals in the southwest who doesn't generally care for guacamole ... pureed avocado (to baby food consistency) with chopped tomatoes is generally not my thing.  But I genuinely can't get enough of the guacamole at Sombreros.  Its chunky avocado, cilantro, tomatoes, lime, and cheese are perfectly put together and served with chips that can carry the load while still managing to be light.  My wife and I typically throw caution to the wind (given that we intend to order dinner entrees, as well), and order the large portion.  There's never any left and we duel for the last bits with warring chips (I hate to admit I lose most of the time).  Although the guacamole is by far our favorite, other appetizers are excellent as well.  The queso fundido (with multiple choices for fillings) is very good, and my wife swears by the huitlacoche crepas, which she often has as a main course to follow the guacamole.  We've never had any entree that didn't live up to expectation, and the Puerco en Chipotle is a favorite that is hard to ignore every time we come.  The pork is incredibly tender and juicy, the chipotle sauce (more like a juice) is spicy without being overwhelming.  With a couple of warm tortillas if you want them, its hard to leave a bite behind.  The Lamb Adobo is excellent as well, and the Pollo con Espinacas (with a chipotle cream sauce) is a spicy taste treat.  The Puerco en Mole Verde received high marks as well.  The entrees come with two traditional sides, and beans, rice, etc. are all fine but nothing exceptional.  Always hoping to find a great margarita when we're out, I've tried many.  There are some good ones to be found to be sure, but I'm impressed by the quality and pour at Sombreros.  My personal favorite is the Cadillac, but there are many excellent ones from which to choose and an outstanding selection of tequilas if you're partial to shots and chasers.    It's been a couple of weeks since I've been there ... I'm feeling the pull.

_Ce0QP99qfwk3XMZgwFPrg.text: Los Sombreros serves the Mexican delicacy Huitlacoche (Corn Smut in English...I know which language I prefer) which is pretty cool and something everyone should get the chance to try. The place is really cute so a meal out on the patio feels a little like a short trip over the border. The menu doesn't have a lot of options for vegetarians (me) but I still really enjoyed my meal & would come back, that's how much I like this place. My boyfriend & I had:  - Queso Fundido with Rajas: Delicious - good real cheese mixed with a lot of peppers & onions. I liked that there was some salsa (or a lot of cooking liquid from the peppers) mixed in with the cheese so it was a lighter fundido than just full on cheese. - Guacamole: Love their guac. It's really chunky & really fresh. - Huitlacoche Crepas: Such an interesting dish & totally unlike what I've had at other Mexican restaurants. The flavor of Huitlacoche is hard to describe - it's savory, a little like mushrooms, has a creamy texture. The flavor combination of the dish was very sweet & savory - savory huitlacoche with sweet pomegranate sauce and seeds with tart blue cheese, all wrapped in a soft crepe.  - Carnitas: My boyfriend ordered this and said the meat was really good. The serving size is enough for 2 meals. The corn tortillas that came with it were really good and fresh. The mexican rice and refried beans that came with it were probably not vegetarian and were just average.  I noticed in the kitchen they cook over a wood-burning stove, which seemed rather authentic and must make their food that much better. The bar is outside & looks like a beach bar, adding to the fun atmosphere.

-wItKrjMelEBg3j6rCsC1w.text: I was not impressed with Los Sombreros. This is a tough thing for me to say because I adore Mexican food. Living in CA, TX and now AZ, I think I've had my fair share of Mexican food and this place doesn't measure up by a long shot.. The food  is very average and fairly expensive for what you get.   The portions were okay, but I still left unsatisfied and hungry..  There are plenty of good Mexican places that serve way better food at almost half the price of Los Sombreros entrees.   I thought the salsa was excellent. Service was decent.  I'm feeling generous-2.5 stars

8QPkkj8A_o491EpvQJE1AQ.text: Good guacamole, nice atmosphere and staff.    I'm still in search of the perfect carne asada though.

6OTPADt9CO1AWAu0ssu_ZQ.text: First, the stuff that cost them a star:  (1) I don't like the high tables. The chairs are so tall my feet dangle and I feel like Lily Tomlin. They were too busy to allow us to sit at a regular table.  (2) They won't do separate checks. (3) The chips came with only two "wagon wheel" chips. The second basket had none, so only half our group got to try them. The basket at the next table had a bunch of them.  Now, the good stuff. The food was very good. I ordered the green corn tamales. They were almost as good as the ones I used to get in Tucson. The others in my party also enjoyed their food. We ordered the guac and it was good, but the presentation piled it high in a mocohete that made it hard to get some on a chip without pushing the rest of the mountain over onto the table or floor. The two in our group that had margaritas said they were delicious, but friends who went the night before said their margaritas were ordinary. Portions were generous. I'm glad I ordered from the left side of the menu or I would have had to be rolled out the door.

I0-Z0wsCETHje7wJy1k7xw.text: If you can get past the decor and the location, you will love the food. If this place was more north on Scotts Rd and looked nicer, everyone would rave about it. Great, authentic mexican food.

x4f9PQlkzImgp5JeaaWyFQ.text: Great- pass on the tamales and chocolate tamale. Just not the best corn mesa. Great mole. Shrimp over cooked, but sauce was amazing.

_ojfMAQwaBYrRwQz4tlsSA.text: We walked in and I think it was right as they were opening. We opted for inside as it was just a little too cool to sit on the patio. Our plan was just to have a small meal and everything was just outstanding. With so many Mexican food restaurants here in Scottsdale, from chain to tex-mex to a truly authentic location like Los Sombreros. I think its hard to get a unique spin on a classic but they do a wonderful job. Next time I'll enjoy the patio and a signature margarita!

nzmGntS9oO91Xa0O8Tsvrw.text: In a city with so many mediocre Mexican options, this is a rare find.  The crab fundido was excellent, as were the seafood enchiladas and pork green chili.  Service was prompt and friendly, even as the place rapidly filled up for the evening rush.

RooXVA0g__8cyd6VK4m63w.text: Go.  Just do it.    You'll walk in the backside of the restaurant to enter and pass the nice patio.  You'll enter a door that splits the bar from the kitchen.  You'll see lined up a bunch of wonderful appetizers and entrees and you'll wonder why you have put up with inadequate food during your trip to Scottsdale.  You'll sit down and get a wonderful server and laugh and eat (get the guac and queso fundito!) and wonder that maybe there is a bit of magic left in Scottsdale, a town where a lot of the native magic has been bottled and bleed away.  It's a great little place and you'll know that for such a small place to make it they have to construct interesting and tasty dishes like Hibiscus Enchiladas.    One of the best meals I've ever had in the Phoenix metro area.  It's a casual, romantic, and fulfilling experience.

zWyyUzShJi2VdXObosqLaQ.text: Very attentive service and the food is unique and very good. Nice to have a 2nd location!

Mw2eT2fxJIYBvqNcHuae5w.text: Went to Sombrero, food was good it was ok, nothing special. Although the service was good, nice atmosphere. I definately prefer "Richardsons Cusine of New Mexico". Unquestionally the finest southwest food in the valley. The rellenios are exceptional, same with the enchiladas. The Beans the best. Margaritas are outstanding. Try it richardsonsnm.com . Dont get me wrong I will go back to Sombrero

3TEpywT0zX1CmoTcPPG_KQ.text: I wasn't very pleased with the menu choices, and the flavors were either too much or too little of "something" .... but I must say, the service was stellar.

akqvR-lp_7EF_9Bg212Lsg.text: Good atmosphere, nice location and decor. I love the bathroom door handles and counterbalance across from the kitchen - my wife loves the red ceiling and brick. Very trendy outdoor eating and bar area, lots of seating - but the bar is tiny, maybe five or six stools. The wait can be an issue, not a place to go if you are in a hurry or starved. Their guacamole is really good, but needs salt and they stuff the bottom of the cool rock bowl with tons of lettuce. The cilantro is a nice touch. Good chips and salsa, why do they charge for it when their entre's are NOT cheap. You pay for the name here, but the quality has not dipped over the years. Really good margaritas, again, a bit overpriced. I am a creature of habit, if I want something different I will go to another restaurant... I always have the Crepas de mariscos - fish/shrimp/crab stuffed enchiladas. Delicious spicy green sauce and the shrimp is NOT over cooked! My wife got the smoked chicken enchilada and liked it - pretty low key response for her, not blown away.   We will go back again, they are 'on par' with Frank and Lupe's which is further north in Old town, I think off Marshall. Nice to have two upscale Mexican restaurants in the same area - we gravitate towards Los Sombreros though...

fERKGacG3CWbSga-09uing.text: I got the pork chipotle and my wife got the smoked chicken enchilada. Mine was good, hers was great!

mMyc5gHgse9VkTQL9X8OWA.text: Mole sauce was amazing! Chicken was a little dry, but searously the mole sauce was good enough to eat with a spoon. Skip the fundido.  The waiter could not explain some of the items on the menu, which was funny. The hicima tostado was great!  so was the mango crab salad.

_l7-EIYkr4CuhVXMrhWzEA.text: First Impressions: Slow service, and seemingly inattentive waiting staff, always busy (in that "will they remember I am sitting here?" kinda way).  The patio is nice to sit at, but that isn't enough to keep me coming back. Maybe I would be more patient on another day, but today I had my five and six year old sons in tow. Don't the wait staff know what a chore it is to keep children seated and entertained while hungry?  There is a special place in hell for restaurateurs that make parents endure this trauma...  As I waited for food. I was getting more and more pissed, and I broke out my mobile yelp to draft a scathing review. BUT, then my food came out.  And damned if I wasn't pleasantly surprised.  All the ingredients were super fresh and cooked to perfection (no wilted veggies or overcooked/dry chicken here).  I've been here a few times and never remember being to so impressed.  Not that they were bad before, just not real memorable.  But this meal was _much_ better than the previous occasions. Did they get new kitchen staff? Are my taste buds off today? Or have I just been ordering the wrong entrees all along? Whatever the case--my food today was delicious (I ordered the chicken enchiladas BTW).    SO... I have mixed feelings about this place.  Service did pick up during the end of the night, but at first it was abysmal.  Food was delicious, but previous visits didn't impress.  Drinks were passable.  Chips and salsa, also passable but not great.   Ambiance, very nice.    Overall, I think I will be back.  Maybe it was an off day for service, or maybe it was an exceptional day for the cook.  Who knows.  But they've earned another try.

N7eLbPNkhnmZ0qmi0V4R9g.text: I thought the food was very good! The one thing that I noticed is that when ordering the large guacamole, 1/3 of it is lettuce on the bottom. I know a lot of places do this, but this is a higher end type of Hispanic food establishment, so I though this would be factored into the price of the food item. Overall, the food was very good and the service was above par.

1MCpocKRlRaZ69l9uv1YXw.text: I had the 10 course meal. $50. First let me say the service is always on point and that matters alot when you go out. Damn near makes up for the food.  Let me start by saying being the son of a mexican chef makes me very, very judgmental. But I can still be fair. The pozole was good. 3.5 stars out five. Good broth and meat. The hibiscus tacos were ok. 2.5 stars. Nothing you would order again. The fig and panela salad was good. 3 stars. Cheese and dressing were great. Shrimp and Papaya salad was ok. 2 stars. Shrimp was old (typical AZ shrimp) Salmon was great! 4 stars. I would order it again. Trout was ok. 2 stars. AZ Fish not very good. Stuffed chicken was great! 4 stars. I mean its stuffed chicken, how can it go wrong? Chile relleno with beef picadillo. Now the star of this show, 5 stars. The inside reminded of a desert they make in Sonora, MX. Its called capirotada. Its sweet and salty, maybe a hint a syrup? Pork loin. 2 stars. Not very inspiring Piloncillo Ice cream. 3 stars. It need something to cut the same flavor profile and make it a complete desert. Look, I know people say its great, but Barrio Cafe is way better with the same $$ point and flavor profile. I want to like it. I really do. But its not what it is cracked up to be.

vy5P5sDIrEyrFrDosVfDEA.text: Authentic.  Check out the back patio and bar rather than the interior restaurant.

iUd_pAB9Mjf4bpmHLTL1tw.text: Coming into the Phoenix area for a family party, we stopped off at Los Sombreros for some margaritas and Mexican on an otherwise cooler night in the valley of the sun.   I was told they are very picky about reservations and, if your party isn't complete, no table. So our 6pm reservation was now in jeopardy because the last two of us (me and my fiance) were running late due to issues on the ramp at Sky Harbor airport, obviously out of our control. But they still didn't want to seat us...  additionally, I overhead on the way to the place that they would only "try" to do their best to accommodate our party, making it sound like they were booked up solid until closing....typical Scottsdale always trying to look more happening and hot than it really is.   Moving on, we somehow "lucked out" (go figure) and had a table no problem, so all the stress caused by the hostess was unnecessary and, in my opinion, pretty unprofessional, especially since the restaurant was empty by 8pm, again, typical Scottsdale.   The menu was brief, and I almost had to double check I wasn't looking at an appetizer. Most of the items are typical Mexican staples with a bit of a Southwestern American twist to them making the food a hit or miss if you ask me, some items were good, some were not. But that's really anywhere I suppose.   The one thing that stood out for me was the Guac. I will say this was flat out delicious but Guac is pretty had to screw up.   The margaritas in my opinion reminded me of something you'd get more at Chilis, a little too sweet for my liking but definitely drinkable.   The fundidto appetizer we ordered left the table empty twice and well I'm not really one to combine seafood and cheese, this blend seemed to have a harmony with others and I'd recommend it to a first timer, +1 if you request to add spinach.   Finally moving on to the entrees, different contraptions from the kitchen filled our table with vibrant colors, assortments and sizes.   I myself ordered what I was told is sort of the house specialty ,call it carnitas mixed in a chipotle sauce with veggies type of deal. While it was tasteful and was more than enough to get the job done for me, the flavor of the pork wasn't really there, at, all.   I browsed over a couple other reviews and noted the same complaint but hey that's what hot sauce is for I guess.   Overall it's an alternative to the chains hoarding Scottsdale road.

jRkU0xVKzTgqpwkNWiySqw.text: We went here because Zagat said "this is where the locals go," and we were not let down. Authentic and flavorful food makes this a must-stop location on our trips here. While your food cooks, nothing beats a great-made ice-cold margarita after a hot golf round.

lU5_TL2dS5ZNYpzyDZqnkg.text: My visit to Los Sombreros was a wonderful meal overall. The building atmosphere is very authentic to the cuisine and the service is attentive. The menu is pleasantly concise and you won't have to worry about feeling overwhelmed choosing an entree.  I had the smoked chicken enchiladas, one of six or so meat choices, with rice and black beans on the side.  The meal came to the table after a short wait, occupied by a nice serving of homemade tortilla chips & house salsa.  Entrees came garnished with steamed vegetables and were hot and fresh.  I could definitely tell that the tortilla used for the enchiladas was homemade and the sauce was stellar. It was quite flavorful with strong cilantro and garlic tones.  If you do not like cilantro, you may not like the sauce, but I found it to be very fresh and zesty.  An experience well deserving of 5 stars.

5QzQ1cfFZxQMA_K7p67y7A.text: This place has gone south quickly. We arrived on a Friday Night. The place was empty, except a few people on the patio, we sat inside. Right after we ordered drinks three employees sat next to us and started to assemble Silverware and napkins and speaking very loudly. Really! One of my favorite dishes in Mexico is Steak Tampiquena, usually a marinated flank steak with cheese enchiladas. My wife and I both ordered it. Not sure what kind of steak it was but it was flavorless and overdone, we both ordered it medium. It also showed up already cut up, which is probably why it was overdone. The enchilada was very small, lacked much sauce and was cold as well. Refried beans were watered down mess. It was like buffet food slapped on a plate. No sizzling steak, no melting cheese, no sauce, no flavor. Help!! Just annoying employees doing their side work next to us. Help!!. This is our third and last time here. The prices are very high for what you get which is below average food and above average prices. Chips and bad "salsa" are extra. No mas Sombreros, the food has gone south and not in a good way. Adios Los Sombreros

3izRKxqimc7G1iSnpRUGQw.text: This place is truly horrible. The prices only add salt to your wound.   There are a lot of great Mexican restaurants in AZ and they are not hard to find. You do not need to pay extra to go to this place. I saw a review in Phoenix magazine and decided to check this place out. The only explanation I can possibly think of is that the  reporter got lazy and decided to skip on the meal and browse the website instead. Literally everything we got from our chips and salsa to our main entrees (recommended by the waiter) was bland.   The patio is cute although we had to sit by some tanks of gasoline which wasn't really a good vibe. While I'm sure this place is healthier than some of the other mexican restaurants it's not worth it.

HfMEt8XiUmCaWwIN0tUO9A.text: I've heard great things about this place and I'm so glad I finally tried it!  The patio is very nice and comfortable if you like to sit outside.  They have many choices of tequila, even a separate tequila menu.  The snapper ceviche was huge, fresh, and very yummy!!  I like that the tortilla soup was made with chicken broth, not creamy or tomato base.  I will definitely be back.

f-gQRbq51biPg5n70Yoj0g.text: For the price, it was definitely not worth it.. Pretty terrible house margarita, too frozen to drink through the straw and pretty flavorless besides the tequila. The tacos were alright, but 3 tiny tacos for $14?? I think it is safe to say I will not be returning.

OGcckSacKhzC2Qi2E_Z0Yw.text: From out of the state, came to get some food, and was turned away because we didn't have a reservation. Hence there was nobody in about 7 tables at 6:05pm.  The host had no remorse or anything. She seemed clueless and had no help. No matter what, don't turn away business of any kind regardless of reservations being booked or not!

vaPp3713WaZYsT2J99yjKg.text: Stopped by here on a Sunday afternoon for a late lunch and the patio was perfect for this sunny day. My server was Rosie and very nice and helpful. I asked about the hibiscus taco because It sounded interesting. She highly recommended it & Rosie was  right! It was savory and a slightly tangy and a morsel of sweetness in every bite. I had chips with their delicious salsa. I highly recommend this place & will be back.

s7XTfoF1C4zbjCP_DtWbVQ.text: We had an absolutely delightful meal which included margaritas.  Everything was so delicious, fresh, and perfectly prepared.  We have been long-time customers but it has been a while and ownership has changed.  The new owners have honored the excellent recipes and we would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants creative mexican soul food.  Brenda had wonderful hibiscus enchiladas and I had a specialty dish with chipotle pork.  All ingredients were of high quality right down to the carrot strips and lime in the margarita.  Excellent!

K55svKta2Nu4j9FPPUwI4w.text: My BFF and I stumbled upon this place, thanks to our lyft driver. We are SO glad for his recommendation.  We were pleased with the menu and, in fact, were overwhelmed by all the options. Everything sounded tasty! The Pollo Con Espinacas was delicious and flavorful but what I loved the most was the Crispy Hibiscus Taco! It was such a fun and tasty combo  ps: the guac was  and the spicy salsa will burn your mouth   Side note: Los Sombreros was a cute restaurant with an old-to wn vibe and super cute decor, especially the women's restroom #random, I know. Just trust me

6__5mrgeqb0b4E0iugc8Yg.text: I always bring out of town friends to Los sombreros.  The service is friendly and the food is excellent.  I was concerned about the change of ownership impacting the food, that is not the case the food always exceeds my expectations.

MrDXSwSKsSPGpf4XwDeBbQ.text: I ate here for lunch with three friends. We found all the food delicious, the service was great, and the ambiance was very nice.  The chips were hot out of the kitchen, and their salsa was excellent. Among the four of us, we ordered Posole, tacos, and something else I cannot recall (it was a month or so ago that we went - sorry). Everything was flavorful and served hot.  Would definitely go again.  It's pretty small, so I wonder if they get crowded quickly?

kPtazCVSnDxd3vhdJ1tz9g.text: I was meeting a group there for lunch and had called ahead to ask if I should call in my order since I am on a limited lunch time and they said no, it wasn't busy and would only take 5 minutes to make tacos.  I get there and waited that whole time, ended up having to ask them to just make mine to-go and left with my lunch time ending.   No fun.   Thirty minutes later my friends call me up: "Hey, that place was gross so we left and are grabbing Julio G's, want some tacos?" :D

LxABFOnOMVLzAcUARPwqTg.text: It gets even better.  The chile relleno covers the entire plate.  The chicken in creme spinach is their best and signature dish.  Cannot say enough for their attention to detail.  And their home made salsa is the best!!!  Great service too!

3x7rcyT6GBzSJjW2AgJu3A.text: It is nice weather to sit outside in the patio. Seafood tacos made with fish and shrimp were delicious with a little bit of sweetness. Chicken mole was delicious with the juicy sauce and tasty warm tortilla. Chips were thin and crisp that went well with two types of green salsa

yxIGQs9cLC95pHvNi3A0oQ.text: Decided to try this off the yelp reviews, and it was an amazing experience. Beautiful patio, great cocktails and EXCELLENT food. The pork pozole was delicious! It is a must when visiting Scottsdale!

HBCFMX97dbB15xQNEPSoJg.text: Average Mexican food. I'm a vegetarian so I'll I can review is the vegetarian options (I'm grateful they had these). All the veggie options were exactly that, vegetables. They definitely could benefit from adding beans and more flavors to these dishes. The guacamole wasn't great either which I think is the pulse on how good a Mexican restaurant will be or is.

Eo9mRMn0CZr3Ef4EXqWflA.text: Great margaritas! Pleasant place to sit and enjoy the food. The tacos are good, but not the best.

TaS1hsKvLFTg0M3wFXS63g.text: Great place and tasty....2 suggestions, make bigger tacos or lower your prices, the place was good but, I left with hungry

9N-4DbW_iTYYxCNcDcVkGQ.text: We placed a catering order for a dozen people. Bobi was responsive and so easy to work with. Everything arrived correctly and delivery was on time. Our group really enjoyed the tacos, guac, enchiladas and jicama salad!

fANH4R35iwjFE3G3V8RXzg.text: Being native Arizonans, we have had every conceivable combination of tortilla, meat, cheese, lettuce, etc.  There is comfort in the same ol' chips and salsa starter followed by some sort of tortilla combination bent, folded, or fried served with a bit of lowered expectations.  And then there is Los Sombreros....  How have we lived for years just down the street from this unbelievable gem?  Layered, nuanced flavors in everything - including an incredible smoky tomatillo salsa that hints of mesquite in the fireplace.  I had a carnitas dish that almost had a barbecue sweetness layered over chipotle smokiness.  Layers.  If you like your food "brown, hot and plenty of it," then Los Sombreros might not be for you.  If you want a taste of Mexico's best family traditions then make your way to Los Sombreros.  We will be hard pressed to return to standard Mexican fare after tasting this food.

xSy6Ig-R2e0_lP9vN9bKng.text: Love, Love, Love, Los Sombreros!  This is a wonderful, South-Scottsdale gem that just keeps getting better!    Here's Why: *Food, OMG, seriously amazing. I have tried multiple things on the menu (weekend brunch, lunch, dinner, and desserts) and never had something I did not think was outstanding.  Fresh, flavorful, innovative takes on traditional items (while staying True to many of the great things about Mexican cuisine).  This is NOT Tex-Mex, its real flavors that some of the best dining in Mexico has to offer.   *Staff/Service, you will probably almost always see one of the owners there when you come in, they are very involved in ensuring a great delivery but even when you don't, the staff is truly outstanding.  Ask them for recommendations, they will never steer you wrong and they are happy to accommodate special requests whenever they can.  They treat you like family.  *Atmosphere, I am "partial" to their large outdoor patio in back, you might not even realize it's there from the street but it's a great spot to dine (weather permitting) and the outdoor bar while small, is quaint and reminds me of some of the great beach-side bars in Mexico.    So thankful to have this level of cuisine in S. Scottsdale while keeping a neighborhood feel with quality results.

7AH2pd6qaC7EJBV9MAuZpw.text: We came to Arizona for vacation and wanted to try some authentic TexMex style food. We found this place on Open Table and am so glad we ate here!! They have two types of salsa and serve a mountain of guacamole!! We ordered chicken tamales and Puerco Chipotle!! These dishes were full of flavor and freshness! We overheard the owner say they just bought it and they are doing a great job! Too bad we don't live here...simply a must try if you are in this area. Chocolate pie is to die for!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PAAKKntilW7PvFTe0ImKZg.text: Last night I wanted to spend my birthday dinner at Los Sombreros because my favorite dessert is their Mexican Chocolate Pie but when we showed up we were told that their was a terrible fly infestation and dining inside wouldn't be good.  GROSS.

j5Hmm1JaidWGcwYwRhDvaA.text: Had a great time. My girlfriend has been here before. My first time. Some of the old servers are now the new owners. They are doing a great job. The food was yummy and the service was impeccable. Great job guys.

1SLPGluupqQNovP7Nc7Q8w.text: Wow, just visiting and this place was close and the food was fantastic! Quesadilla was sooo good. It's different and that's what made it so delicious.

y-li_jyAx4IY5AVSR3q9Rg.text: The ambiance is nice.  The food, not so much.  I've lived in Scottsdale for nearly 40 years and this was among the worst Mexican food I've ever had. After my second bite I was not only grossed out, but seriously concerned for my safety and that of the other patrons, as the chicken in my tortilla soup smelled gamey and rotten.  My wife sent back her posole as well, as it was flavorless.  The people were extremely nice and immediately took these off my bill when we sent it back - something we NEVER do. My 7 year old son seemed to like his food, which he ate before mine arrived, but now, a few hours later, he's sick to his stomach.  Again, very nice people and a great atmosphere, and from what I saw it looks like they make good cocktails, but the food itself was not good and appears to have made my kiddo sick.  I can't say I'd ever come back.

3WNNpTKSsHwkK4mlFuPeIA.text: This is a very cute place - small inside dining area, but comfortable.  You could tell the food was fresh and well prepared - however, it was fairly bland.  We had the steak tacos and green corn tamales - and there just was not much flavor.   I admit I like my food more on the spicy side, but even my husband who will tolerate much more mild food was disappointed in the lack of flavor. The people were very nice - service was great..... just need to work on the food a bit!

kVazlPxKLb0fxcbVGfyXPg.text: Amazing place!  Great food, friendly staff, clean, awesome outside bar.  Not sure what else there is i should expect!   Both myself and wifey eat vegetarian and there were plenty of tasty options for us....plus the great drink selections.  I had the potato blackbean enchilada and it was to die for!  We were out of towners visiting from Los Angeles, what a great find!  Try it, you won't regret it.    Kurt

cf-chSS8040IgGplNJ7bvA.text: Man the new ownership really shows. Been here twice since the reopening and love it. My favorite was Taco Tuesday! $2 Tecate and $3 special tacos till close...We had the Shrimp and Goat Cheese, Salmon and Mango Pico & the can't go wrong al Pastor.  Service was great and again, food was great. If you haven't been or haven't been in a while you will have a good time for sure.   Almost forgot, regular menu - ribeye tacos are BOMB!!

Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon and Mango Pico tacos

A9AnlIRL8-0bmDSREzbOrg.text: Best Mexican I've had in a long time!  When seated we were greeted by Alex - our server. He automatically made a connection with us. He was funny and sweet. I don't see many servers now with such charisma. One of the owners came by and was cracking jokes with us. It was nice to see an owner working and making sure everyone was having a good time. Great atmosphere, great service and great food!   I haven't had an experience like that in a long time.

bDrjiJEz3L2GbDeUwU-S8g.text: Went here to celebrate my birthday with family.  Wonderful food and interesting rustic interior. Gave it 5 stars for the food and great service but entrees were a bit expensive for what you get. ($22-32) so if you just order margaritas and tacos it's a better deal.  Fresh guacamole was great but portions could be better...we had to order 2 large for group of 5. Oh, the Margaritas are wonderful too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5kHwvKWFEQC8gS7XY970Jg.text: Fabulous food. Great atmosphere and awesome service had the best tamales , guacamole.would highly recommend!

XQ8b1539TWDxu5yg9e3PNg.text: Won't be coming back here. Terrible service. Food sat under the heat lamp until it was room temperature. There was only one other table occupied in the whole restaurant. Had to get up and ask for my bill because my server didn't come back to the table after dropping off our room temperature meals. By the way only order 3 tacos and a quesadilla. Big thumbs down.

vnQvMQE2EavMCXhNi_EAMA.text: So yesterday, May 6th, my 2 friends and I went here because I raved about how good the food is .. and the food is definitely 5 star!!!    The 1 star rating is for the situation that occurred yesterday. It was HOT out there, HOT, like 104.  The bar to the is naturally connected to the building, meaning, that the entrance to the bar is an open door to the rest of restaurant, well inside the dining room there were only 2 other tables when we sat down. We opted to sit at a table that was NOT year an a/c vent as one my friends was elderly and did not like the a/c blowing on her.  So here is the MAJOR PROBLEM I have and why I rated this 1 star.  So the flies that were INSIDE the restaurant were RIDICULOUS, I mean it ruined the whole dinner!! We were constantly killing flies, swatting flies, off us, off our food, out of our drinks.   HERE is my beef: when we told the restaurant staff, hostess and waitress, we were told that the Ecolab guy was supposed to show up there earlier in the day but cancelled and was going the next day.  MY PROBLEM IS THIS: they KNEW the flies were bad, they KNEW the Ecolab person was not coming for another day, THERE IS AN ACE HARDWARE less than 1/2 mile down the road, WHY DIDN'T THEY GO TO ACE AND GET SOME FLY TRAPS/FLY STRIPS......SOMETHING  TO CONTROL THE FLIES????  It was  utterly ridiculous.  I LOVE this place, the food is amazing, but to knowingly sit people in a room full of flies and be ok with it??? WRONG ANSWER!   I know this place is under new ownership as of some time last year, because when I took my then bf there one of the owners was there and actually came to our table to ask how we were and how our service and food was. He was pretty young, and I hope that he will read this review and school his employees on this.  As we were leaving a group of about 10 people came in to sit in the dining room, we thought, 'oh great, something to draw the flies away rom us" lol, but as quickly as they sat down they left to sit out side, when I asked if they were leaving because of the flies, they said YES !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. One of MANY flies that we trapped in our drinks and drowned!  RIDICULOUS !
Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fly that landed in my lady friends tea!!!

blzy4HKsMo9asFnEh8Q-Dg.text: I drive by this place almost every day and finally after remembering to check reviews my husband and I went there last night! We were not disappointed! First, our waiter, Moses, treated us like we were his only customers! There are 3 owners, two were there and very attentive to everyone as well! They obviously enjoy their job! Very knowledgeable of all the dishes, Moses is too. THE FOOD: AMAZING!!! I had the lamb because of all the past reviews! It did not disappoint! My husband had the chicken dish with the long name! That was amazing! We sat on the patio and cannot wait to go back! Definitely our new go to place for Friday date night!!  You have got to go check it out, you won't be so UPDATE: I got the lamb and took the left over sauce home! We used it over tilapia! YUM YU UPDATE: we've been back 2 times since! LOVE this place! We're working through the specials! Have not been disappointed. Service is excellent, servers very friendly, and at least 1 owner is always - walking around greeting, helping, rolling up their sleeves when they need to! We'll be regulars soon!!

sv8qFfAQ4NZj7-AdcTFtXQ.text: We placed a catering order for a family get together and the food was a huge hit!  Next time we will order extra potato tacos, they were so good! Everything from the chips and salsa to the tacos were fantastic!  We will definitely be back for more!

-9iccojshUMACKy0G1gAEw.text: OK, if you haven't been here, you MUST!! It is a "joint" & not much by way of ambience, but the food & selections are totally amazing!! It's my Mexican Food take out go to every time

photos.caption: Photo of Los Sombreros - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dXJGx305p1W-JUk0HwQzdQ.text: Stumbled onto this little gem when I put "Mexican Restaurants" near me into maps.  All I can say is wow!  Truly authentic and original dishes.  Simple surroundings, but great, friendly service.  And don't let the price scare you off--it was was worth every penny!  We will definitely be back the next time we're in Scottsdale.

iARINmSCVGVDVrQvuxhjWA.text: We met a friend here for dinner last month to celebrate the holidays.  It had been years since we visited and after this delicious dinner, we were left wondering why it took us to long to make a repeat visit.  Nice atmosphere, great service and tasty food.  I highly recommend the potato and goat cheese enchiladas with rice and sauteed vegetables...perfect dinner combination!

5zgVoy4HbZrUBvt_XHfGDA.text: A great local recommendation! We came in from San Diego and asked the front desk at our hotel for a local recommendation. We didn't want all the typical chains near the hotel. She recommended Los Sombreros, so we grabbed a Lyft and were pleasantly surprised at the great atmosphere and 'home cooking' vibe. Our waiter, David, was pleasant and attentive. He seemed genuinely excited to recommend his favorites that he was certain we would enjoy.  The fresh chips came out piping hot and were delicate and crispy. They may have been a little too good because I could not stop my hand reaching for more of them before I realized I was probably going to ruin my appetite. The guacamole was fresh, delicious, and generously portioned. The shrimp cocktail included perfectly cooked jumbo shrimp in a wonderful sauce. For our main course, we shared the Lamb Adobo, which was a full lamb shank, slow cooked to fall off the bone tenderness.

d4jVQf0uGbkvCpibcEk_6A.text: My favorite local joint!  Best authentic Mexican food around!  We live sitting at the bar and having a cocktail and delicious meal.  You feel like you're at a little bar somewhere in Mexico.  Staff is awesome to

aAbLegkgBI4PQQcTIDWWnw.text: Great home style Mexican , salsa is a bit off it seems , selections are wide . The only thing is the hibiscus is a little too prevalent in many dishes

AWsbHldJ2VPZ2TBgLIPzmQ.text: Service? Great. Food? Worse than even average. My enchiladas were pretty dry and disappointing. Both salsa weren't any good, either. Unfortunately, I won't be returning.

5L_2h9QftpcjP8s3-NxdPw.text: Great food with great service from Alex!  A place that I'll bring out of town guests too and be proud of the food.  Will definitely be back!

hAVlMfkVVINgLUJOcv8CjA.text: Slow service, boring beans and rice, overcharged for my expensive lunch.  Won't return.

Jjj5IH66CKZd1deG5XqHWg.text: We just moved to the area and were very excited for being so close to this place! Literally walking distance! The ambience and service are authentic, but the food is just NOT RIGHT! The chips are plain, salsa is good, of each dish we've chosen, none was eatable! The refried beans tasted anything but beans! All we can say is that it is a shame such a good location, and potential, we so little care for the food it self! Hopefully it will change for nothing remains the same forever!

GK0UAARwycqHhv0SsDRpsg.text: My husband and I had the 10 course tasting menu....fabulous! We were so stuffed by the end of it we were sad we couldn't try anything on the regular menu. Great service and the VERY COLD beer was a wonderful addition to an already perfect meal.
